Reviews.Title: “Great stay with children”
Reviews.Author: wildrosetwins
Reviews.Content: Positive: We approached the front desk for check-in and the lady gave our girls a welcome gift with plenty of goodies and we received chocolate chip cookies. She was very helpful with giving us a detailed map of tourist locations, coupons, and told us what area to avoid. Close location to the waterfront and Gas Town. Kids 6 and under eat free so that was a great bonus. We had a nice sleep, beds were comfy, the view from our room was awful but we just slept there. The view from the den was much better looked out over Hastings. To go to your floor you must use your room card in the elevator - nice security feature. Negatives: We had to have our suppers in the lounge; would have been nice if the breakfast restaurant was open for families in the evenings.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Melissa R
Reviews.Content: We travelled to Vancouver with our 2 boys (8 & 9yrs) and had a wonderful trip. The staff at the Delta were amazing. They gave the boys a package of toys and chocolate chip cookies when we checked in. They were very helpful in assisting us in making reservations or giving us suggestions on things to do in the city. The only downside is that the rooms are a bit small for a family of 4. It is in a great location and easy to get to transportation. We will definately stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Efficient, fast and friendly”
Reviews.Author: Love2taste
Reviews.Content: This location is not right next to the other 4 or 5 stars hotel such as the Fairmont and right on the edge of the more questionable area of vancouver. when you look out your window, you will see some very interesting shops and businesses. it is quite far from Robson street but completely doable. this hotel definitely needs a facelift and the staff claimed it will happen in the next few years. the rooms are clean but definitely not worthy of 4 stars. the price is somewhat high for what you get. BUT, the service i received, almost, made up for the oudated rooms and location. we met w/ Genalia in the hospitality suite and she was incredibly gracious and decent. in fact, most of the staff were really great. although, there are a couple front desk staff that were not as warm and friendly as they could be. the hotel has this really weird open table check in/out area and i really disliked it. it must have been some kind of experiment in the past to be closer to their guests. but, i find it really annoying to be standing so close to the person checking me in or out of the hotel. i hope they change that configuration when the remodel.

Reviews.Title: “Easter Weekend”
Reviews.Author: Hazley
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent two days at the Delta Vancouver Suites over the Easter Weekend, and like most of the reviewers, we were quite impressed. This was our first visit to this hotel, although we have been frequent visitors to other Delta Hotels. By way of full disclosure, because of those visits, we were able to use an available upgrade which moved us from the regular room we booked and paid for, to a Signature Club room on the 21st floor, with a view to Burrard Inlet. Other than the view, the room itself was fairly standard, but came with all the basics, robes, great wifi and a very comfortable bed. Other than an oddly shaped sink, there is nothing to complain about. The really great thing about the Signature Club rooms is the free breakfast in the morning and snacks in the afternoon. Breakfast was first rate, and included something hot, either pancakes or french toast in our case. Like pretty well all the Vancouver hotels, it's downtown, and in this case on the eastern edge, which made many things walking distance, including BC Place and the hockey arena. Parking was included in our rate, which is a good thing because it seems to be quite expensive otherwise.

Reviews.Title: “HELPFUL AND FRIENDLY”
Reviews.Author: Johnny041
Reviews.Content: During a recent skiing holiday to Whistler, my partner John broke his leg and was transferred to a hospital in Vancouver. As we were staying in a Delta Suites in Whistler, we transferred to Delta Vancouver for the remainder of our stay. The staff at Delta Suites could not be friendlier. Allison greeted me on arrival and heard my sorry story, made several offers during my stay to help with ANYTHING. Daniel bought my luggage to the room, again hearing my story, helped me with advice on how to get to Lions Gate hospital each day to visit John. When John returned to the hotel, Donnie organised for additional pillows, blankets and foot stool to be delivered to our room when he saw what had happened. The down town location was great for me as I could go into town each day for a few hours while we were hold up in Vancouver waiting for the insurance company to organise our trip home to New Zealand. We had to organise an additional night and very late checkout, which was not problem even though the hotel was very busy. I cannot remember everyone's name who showed a great deal of concern and willingness to help, we could not have asked for a better place to be. If the Delta staff read this, again Cheryl and John from New Zealand send a big THANK YOU for all your help and concern for us. If we are ever back in Vancouver we would definitely be staying at the Delta Suites.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome location and staff!”
Reviews.Author: mgottlieb26
Reviews.Content: I used a Groupon to stay at the Delta Vancouver Suites with some friends before we headed back to the East Coast after a ski trip in Whistler. From the second we walked into the hotel, the staff were extremely welcoming and helpful (we even got cookies when we checked in!). The room that we stayed in was fine - nothing outstanding but it was pretty clean. The suite 'living room' had a pretty outdated tv and old furniture but we had a nice view of the city. The front desk was really helpful in suggesting fun things to do in Vancouver for the few hours that I had before my flight. I stored my luggage there before I left for the airport and it was an easy 2 block walk to the train that goes to the airport. The hotel is in a great location - near some restaurants and tourist spots. I'd definitely consider staying here again if I go back to Vancouver for the customer service alone.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Tana H
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay at this hotel. We managed to have a bit of an early check in and a bit of a late check out which was very accommodating. Everyone was so helpful and willing to do anything extra to make our stay great. The staff were very friendly, rooms clean and modern and lots of amenities. The location was with walking distance to so many things.I would highly recommend this place!

Reviews.Title: “"heart of the city"”
Reviews.Author: eyewander
Reviews.Content: this hotel offers location, comfort, attentive staff and great food. It's located within walking distance of major rail lines (Canada Line, Intercity rail) trendy and shopping areas (Gas town, Pacific Mall, waterfront), great eateries (international and Canadian flavours).

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Treylya
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night when we went to a Canucks Game. The hotel is very nearby the Canada Line and in easy walking distance to BC Place and Rogers Arena. The suite was a nice size and the bed very comfortable. The rooms on the higher floors have amazing views. Staff were very pleasant and helpful. All in all we would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Alberta606
Reviews.Content: Great location downtown, 3 blocks from gas town and Granville st (bars), close to sky train, water buses, malls,etc. Our room had a mini living room with a foldout couch and 2 chairs, large bathroom, 2 tvs, mini fridge, and safe. We had a view of the bay and room service was quick. A good place to stay if wanting to explore Vancouver and enjoy the night life.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, great staff”
Reviews.Author: maldivesod
Reviews.Content: This is a very good business hotel...modern design, airline kiosk in lobby, very clean, good sized rooms. The staff (from reservations to front desk) are excellent - very friendly, helpful, and NOT dismissive when you have a problem. The location is good...one block from the train station re: train to and from airport. There are plenty of restaurants and coffee shops nearby (Starbucks across the street, and the Harbour Centre across street has food fair, small shops (closes at 6pm I think)...great shopping (the Bay, Holt Renfrew, Pacific Centre) about a 10 minute walk away. Tourist areas such as Gastown (nice shops) and Chinatown are about 5 minutes away. I was a little apprehensive about being on Hastings Street, but it is long street and the downtown eastside is far enough away that it was not really an issue... The suites are a good size, lots of light, good workspace, and nice clean bathrooms. The bed and pillows were very comfy. Highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms and great service”
Reviews.Author: Daniel S
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in early March 2012, we came down early around noon and the had an executive suite available early so that was nice. The front desk staff were very helpful. Our room was nice there was a king size bed in one room with a tv and a sperate living room, which was nice as my girlfriend wasn't feeling too well so I was able to let her sleep shut the door and go watch tv in the other room. The hotel is right on the border of the nice part of Vancouver and a bit of shady part but you dont really notice it. One thing of note, we asked a fellow (I beleive he was taking the bags for other guests) where a good place for a quick breakfast would be, I know his mind was in the right place but he sent us to an grungy cafe that yes was affordable (something like 4.00 for a full breakfast) the place was gross so we did not stay and ended up going somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Central, convenient & Great staff”
Reviews.Author: maguirecn
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Delta Suites Hotel as I was on busines in Vancouver. I'd had a long flight with mutiple stops and, chatting with the reception staff expressed surprise that I was going to be charged for internet access; my room was immediately upgraded and the internet access was free of charge. My room was large, appeared newly decorated and furnished. As I was staying for an extended period, I asked the same receptionist for a kettle, small fridge and microwave. These were provided within an hour of my request. The hotel has a small but well appointed business centre for printing documents, boarding cards etc. The staff attitudes very good throughout the hotel. The hotel is very centrally placed in Downtown Vancouver, close to the Harbour (for trips to Vancouver Island) and to the railway station from where the Harbour Ferry, Skytrain and West Cost trains run. Lots of good restaurants nearby and the Steamworks pub/brewery is about five minutes walk next to the Central PAcific railway station

Reviews.Title: “Top Choice to stay in Vancouver, friendly staff, excellent service”
Reviews.Author: TerTrav
Reviews.Content: Kudos to this hotel. It's obvious this hotel gets it! The facilities are top notch, comfortable quiet rooms - but even more important the staff are genuinely friendly and they really care about your stay and your experience. This Delta obviously hires their people based on personality and commitment - and it shows. We got a god deal through Priceline but the front desk staff were able to make it even better by offering a very slight upsale to a signature club room - which includes room upgrades, a deluxe buffet breakfast and complimentary evening hors d'oeuvres in the exclusive signature club lounge. All the staff made us feel like honored and welcome guests. In this excellent staff, Judy the evening signature club hostess stood out even more customer service-wise (after one meeting she remembered our names). The hosts at all the Delta SC Lounges should take lessons from her. Our top choice from now on in Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Nice big rooms, floor to ceiling windows”
Reviews.Author: thirty1flvr
Reviews.Content: The staff were very friendly. The rooms were great. A small sitting room with a seperate bedroom with king size bed. The floor to ceiling windows make for a nice view and lots of natural light. Good location with lots of restaurants nearby. A reasonable walk down to Rogers Arena - though it's not next door.

Reviews.Title: “Excellence in service”
Reviews.Author: marleenkok
Reviews.Content: The staff at this hotel is out to earn the "beyond expectations" on their job reviews. Every single person that we encountered was very friendly, courteous and more than helpfull. The location of the hotel is perfect, right in the middle of the city. We walked from the Central Pacific Train station to the hotel. The Sky train is a block away and the Seabus was about 2 blocks away. We stayed in a Signature Club room. The room came with hors d ouvers and a continental breakfast. They were both served in the Signature Lounge. Very handy to be able to go have your breakfast and be on your way! The room itself was very business like. Not so much for a romantic getaway. The beds were very comfortable and the room was quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing view!”
Reviews.Author: Naomi_Kristine
Reviews.Content: The room was wall to wall windows and we had an amazing view of downtown Vancouver. The king-size bed and feather duvet was so comfortable we stayed in our room all night. The hotel is conveniently located to the main skytrain station. You can take the skytrain directly to the River Rock Casino.

Reviews.Title: “Decent rate, pretty central location”
Reviews.Author: Seat11A
Reviews.Content: Good rate and service at this Delta, whose the open foyer reception stands stressing an "express" type of service, at least this was my impression (which is not a critique). Clean rooms, free wifi (at least in my package) and warm cookie on check-in always appreciated -- it's the small things that count. Location is not far from waterfront and gastown. Really comfy bed and pillows.

Reviews.Title: “a NICE DOWNTOWN HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: disco-dale
Reviews.Content: This is the place to stay if want a downtown feel close to Gastown and the Convention centre. Rooms are nice and modern, clean and functional..... One of the cities favorites!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing one-night stay with a groupon deal!”
Reviews.Author: Nicole S
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I decided to take this hotel up on their groupon deal which was about $128 per night (parking and internet access included). The room was clean and beautiful. It was a corner suite so we had great views. Every staff members we encountered was helpful and friendly. They even gave us delicious, warm chocolate chip cookies at check-in. Nothing says have a happy stay better than chocolate! So they already scored points with me. The hotel isn't in the seediest part of hastings, but it's still not a great area. Compared to the street, the hotel is like a palace. Starbucks directly across the street. Five minute walk to Tim Horton's & 7-11. I would definitely go back!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Bell Captain”
Reviews.Author: malcolm s
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent a couple of days at the hotel and it was a very good experience. One of your staff, Donnie Whalen the Bell captain, in particular made our stay very enjoyable. He has an extremely friendly and helpful manner and his kindness made our stay memorable. Thank you Donnie.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Great service”
Reviews.Author: Brynntheredonethat
Reviews.Content: I recently spent 3 nights at Delta Vancouver Suites for business. I was very impressed with the service that was given at the Delta. The staff was friendly and seemed to genuinely be concerned about my stay. The bed was very comfortable and the room was clean. I had dinner at the hotel one night and it was very tasty!! The service was excellent. I would recommend the Delta Suites to anyone wanting a clean, comfortable and pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely the BEST hotel in downtown Vancouver!”
Reviews.Author: travelwizcanada
Reviews.Content: I LOVE the Delta Vancouver Suites and won't stay anywhere else in downtown Vancouver anymore! The location is amazing. I take the train from the Airport and just walk up to the hotel. There are lots of restaurants and shopping close by - I have eaten in the hotel restaurant too and it was good. The staff are the nicest I've met in all my travels and the service amazing...they will do anything for you! The rooms are large and always clean, and their beds are so comfortable which is really important to me! I wish there was a Delta Vancouver Suites in every city I have to travel to!

Reviews.Title: “Looking forward to returning”
Reviews.Author: tdng
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 3 nights at the end of a business trip. This was my third visit to the hotel and, as ever, the staff were incredibly friendly and were always willing to do that little extra to help. The beds are very comfortable and the rooms clean and spacious. The internet in the room was fast and reliable enough to let me get onto my office network in the UK and work with some reasonably large files. I also ate in the lounge downstairs one night and found the food to be surprisingly good value for eating in a chain hotel as well as good quality. This was due to a set menu being in use which gave you 3 courses for $28. The location is great for downtown and for getting to the North Shore. I cannot find anything to fault this hotel over. This has become my hotel of choice in Vancouver and I am looking forward to returning when I am next visiting the city.

Reviews.Title: “Not what it claims to be”
Reviews.Author: mooseremote
Reviews.Content: I am a regular user of Priceline "name your price" hotel scheme. The whole idea behind it was that when hotels have unsold space, they might as well fill it up. A cheaper price is still better to the hotel than an empty room. If it were a 4 star hotel, you'd get a 4 star room and 4 star service at a reduced price. The hotel would get a reasonable amount of money for their empty room which, otherwise, they would have receive nothing. Everybody wins. Well, Delta hotels in Canada, and especially this one, have found a way around this. They call it a 4 star hotel but it's not if you book on Priceline, hotwire, or a similar service that now many websites emulate. This hotel has many floors specially reserved for these "lower paying" customers. The beds do not have cushy toppers or fluffy comforters. The suites are missing furniture and may only include a nightstand and two chairs in the corner of what they consider the "living room". The "sofa," if there is one, is a smallish love seat barely big enough for two small behinds. The rooms are not 4 star. In my view what you get is a 2.5 star room. So, I complained at the front desk and was met with silly arguments like "you wouldn't expect us to rent a penthouse for a Priceline rate." It was clear they had head this many times before. If it's advertized as a 4 star room, I expect a 4 star room. I complained the next day again, but this time I could find a manager and I was moved to a "regular" room which was much better. This proved I was correct in my assessment. But, even these regular room room were no better than the mini-suites I've seen of the roadside chains. Not a 4 star downtown hotel. Both Delta and Priceline need to clean up their act on this matter.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Delta Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: ridemaui
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 1 night in January 2012. Very nice rooms, beautiful linens, big bathroom. I liked the 'suite' layout with the separate bedroom, very cosy. Living room area was a good size too. Very friendly staff - we would definately return. Got a great deal on Hotwire.

Reviews.Title: “good location”
Reviews.Author: johnbalmer
Reviews.Content: nice hotel in a good location in downtown Vancouver.....rooms are nice, not good for families, but nice for couples etc...small suites but really not much room....one bathroom....we wanted a suite for 4 people and were happy not to be spending more than one night.....nice but.......

Reviews.Title: “Great downtown spot”
Reviews.Author: Kelly S
Reviews.Content: Stayed here after working in Surrey, BC in the week. Wanted to enjoy downtown Vancouver for the weekend before heading home to Ontario. Got a great deal on Hotels.com for the room. Was able to check in a bit earlier than 3pm without any cost. Lady working the front desk was very helpful in assisting me with information I needed, maps for the area and where to find things like Starbuck's, good sushi, Skytrain station, etc. They also organized a cab for me for 6am the morning I left and let me use the Business Centre without any issue to check in for my flight online. Reviews and even co-workers mentioned the hotel is in a rough part of town and I wasn't sure what to expect. I was out after dark both nights I stayed there, although not terribly late, and felt better knowing the doors to the hotel were locked on the less safe street sides. I knew this before returning, so came through the right entrance. You also need your room key to access the elevator for safety reasons too. I did not feel nearly as "unsafe" as i thought I would, as a woman, which was great. The rooms weren't huge, but given it's downtown Vancouver, they were bigger than I expected. I found it a bit hard to find optimal room temperature but I managed to get myself more than comfortable to sleep both nights. You can also open your window a bit, which is great for a bit of fresh air with the dry heat of a hotel room in the winter. I ordered room service one night, not a bad price for a hotel room service and the food was awesome. It was also very timely in it's delivery. Starbuck's is right across the street for breakfast and the Waterfront Station for the Skytrain is a 5 minute walk. Room was clean, well equipped and bed was very comfortable. I thought it advertised an iHome station, so I assumed (as I've experienced) that there would be a docking station to recharge my iPod before my flight home.There was not and I forgot to ask about it. Steam Works is a restaurant/pub just 2 blocks away from the hotel, along the waterfront and I highly recommend it for a casual pub experience. Beer was great, service was great and it was very close. It's got couches and comfy chairs as well as bar tables and stools. Went on a Friday night,very busy but good service and great local beer. Delta was pretty central to tourist areas. Took the city bus to just before Stanley Park and walked from stop, across from the Lookout and walking distance to Robson Street (shopping). I will stay here again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Second stay - highly recommend”
Reviews.Author: kayteeYVR
Reviews.Content: I have now stayed at this hotel in my own city twice for national meetings with colleagues. This time, like my previous visit, I was impressed with the excellent staff. They greet guests with warmth and efficiency. The room set up is outstanding (all rooms are suites with a separate bedroom area). The location can't be beat - Waterfront station (with Canada Line public transportation to airport) is steps away, Pacific Centre (for shopping) is nearby, as are multiple restaurants. Staff assisted us with restaurant recommendations and efficiently addressed any issues related to our group booking. My only small beef with the hotel is that I wish the internet was free (internet was $17 per day). The hotel did have an offer during our stay where you could move to an upgraded (higher floor) room that included internet for $15 per day. However, not everyone in our group was made aware of this at check-in. It would just be easier and so much more welcoming if internet was free at Delta and other chains that are holding out on this feature. Nonetheless, I had a wonderful stay and would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The Delta never dissapoints!”
Reviews.Author: hernameislola
Reviews.Content: We always stay at the Delta for the convienent location downtown. We have never been dissapointed with the service. The staff goes above and beyond to accomadate your needs. They usually upgrade us at no cost which is great! Our last stay we got to have a floor to ceiling window room for a fraction of the cost to upgrade. The accomadations are pretty much the same as the fairmont , but you get less of the snobby guests. Overall I would reccomend the Delta Vancouver Suites to Anyone adn everyone. LOVE IT! we also love that it's close to restaurants and just a few steps to get our Tim's coffee in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “Have stayed here twice and both time have been fantastic”
Reviews.Author: LeslieOSeattle
Reviews.Content: I am a regular visitor to Vancouver and have stayed here twice. The rooms are up to date, comfortable and the location is great. The staff is excellent. My first trip there I needed ice and had asked the front desk which floor it was on, they sent someone up who filled the bucket for me. Totally above and beyond anything I expected. My most recent trip (this week) there was some confusion over my reservation (that I had booked through another website) and, although it was a little concerning/frustraing to start off with, the woman I worked with moved me to a bigger suite than the one I was supposed to have to make up for the convenience. This was not something I asked for so I really appreciated her offering. It was a lovely room on one of the highest floors, great view and clean and comfortable. Would stay here anytime!

Reviews.Title: “Great for your money..”
Reviews.Author: iscreenwriter
Reviews.Content: Have been to Vancouver a bunch of times. Stayed in a number of hotels. This is by far the best bang for your buck. Very much like the Westin in which the rooms are suites. Only differene is the price. At times you can get this hotel for $100 per night less and there isn't much of a difference. Westin is a tad nicer but not much different. Delta has large suites with rooms connected to living areas. Lobby isn't much to brag about but you are in Vancouver - one of the nicest cities in the world. Area can be the only issue witht this hotel but it didn't matter to me. It is on Hastings St. 5-7 blocks away is the nototrious "Downtown Eastside" one of the heaviest drug infested areas in the world. It is far enough away that it isn't an issue here but having stayed at the Westin and Sheraton i would say with smaller children it is worth staying further from that area. Last two times i have been in Vancouver i stayed here. Would again.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home”
Reviews.Author: Nils62
Reviews.Content: OK, I have stayed in a lot of hotels in my life, but I have never stayed at a hotel were the staff was trained and encouraged to treat it's guests like abolute gold before. I booked this hotel based on the reviews of some of the other tripadvisors and I have not be disappointed. The rooms are very nice mini-suites with every possible feature thoughtfully planed and executed. But it's the stafff that really makes the difference. We stayed on one of the "Signature Level" floors and went to the Club Lounge for breakfast every morning and for drinks and appetizers every evening. The staff running the lounge were so sweet and nice. One night my wife mentioned that she was feeling a little cold. Later that evening, the hotel sent up a bowl of wonderful chicken soup to make her feel a little better! You won't find that kind of service and attention in any corporate hotel I have ever stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: Grums
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed a weekend stay. Great location close to cruise ship docks, sea wall and Gastown. Very nice staff in reception. Asked why we came to Vancouver and we mentioned our anniversary and was upgraded to Privlege. Parking and entrance off the laneway is odd and additional parking for pick up and rop offs would be better. Nice room with view. Breakfast was very good however, personal beef, why do people think it is ok to enter and stay in the breakfast room wearing just their bathrobe and no shoes. Most people really don't want to know if or if you did not take a shower nor look at barefeet while they are eating. Staff should be told to kindly address this for the sake of other guests or place a sign asking for proper dress or offer them room service.

Reviews.Title: “Delta Suites Hotel Vancouver Canada”
Reviews.Author: Maggieprill
Reviews.Content: We spent a week at the Delta Suites in Vanacouver and would not hesitate to recommend it to anyone visiting Vancouver. It was well located close to the waterfront in the business district and within easy reach of the restaurant area. The staff were friendly and helpful, the breakfasts very good and although we had only two meals in the restaurant both were definetly haute cuisine. We were delighted with our suite which was spacious and well appointed. Altogether it was very good value. It was our first visit to Vancouver and I would strongly suggest visiting in spring. The city was a blaze of colour as all the cherry trees dogwoods etc were in full blossom. Vancouver in spring must be one of the prettiest cities in the world!

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: Rigana
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Vancouver Delta Suites on more than one occasion. This time I brought my mother, sister and husband to attend family gathering. When I booked, I specified there would be four adults and that I wanted a Signature suite with a sofa bed if possible. When we checked in, I reiterated my reques for a sofa bed and was told that ws why we were receiving.The room had a cot standing up on it's side blocking the window, no sofa bed, two chairs (for four people), two glasses (for four people) and two mugs (for four people). I want to acknowledge that when I called housekeeping, they promptly provided more glasses, mugs and a chair. For makeshift blankets, we made do with the two bathrobes in the room as the cot only had one thin blanket. I would have rathered being told at the time of check in that the room I waned was not available. I would also prefer not to be responsible for asking for extral glasses etc. For a room occupied by more than two guests as it isn't rocket science or u reasonable to expect that four people need four glasses, mugs, pillow, blankets, etc. On a positive note, the from was clean, well appointed,fast Internet, quiet and comfortable. The Signature Lounge was fine and the staff friendly and helpful. The location of the hotel is excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Friendly and Efficient Staff”
Reviews.Author: KED3
Reviews.Content: Grey Cup weekend in Vancouver was made even better by the great location of this hotel. We had booked some time ago and received a great rate through one of the discount booking organizations. The staff were terrific and friendly and went beyond the call of duty to ensure our stay was a good one. If you need to be downtown in Vancouver, this is worth a stay.

Reviews.Title: “awesome for business”
Reviews.Author: GoinPeace
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a block from the skytrain station. The staff is friendly , restaurant is good and you can walk to get coffee and food outside the hotel. The rooms are great with seperate sleeping area from the main space. It is not noisy, good insulation and heating system. I haven't really had a better stay and it rival's the Fairmont Waterfront at a much lower cost for EVERYTHING...only thing missing is a pool and the view.

Reviews.Title: “Will return - great service.”
Reviews.Author: Amanda B
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a week in Aug 2011. The location is amazing. We flew to Vancouver with a 4 year old and took a train with all of our stuff and walked from the train - literally 1 block. Perfect! And it is right by the water which is a plus. The staff was super kind and helpful. Willing to get us whatever information we needed and there to answer any question we had. At one point my daughter smashed a glass in our bathroom. The staff was there in less than 3 mins to clean it up and was super pleasant about it. They offered us a larger fridge since we had a small child and were staying for a entire week. It was really helpful. The room was not huge but it was fine for a vacation. The bed was super comfy - the sofa bed was not so comfy but served my 4 year old well. I can't comment on the food since we did not eat there. The only thing I would change about the hotel is to add a pool, it was missed travelling as a family. We will be back!!

Reviews.Title: “Very happy with this hotel and its location”
Reviews.Author: WendyFsj_Bc
Reviews.Content: My husband and I walked for blocks around the area along the ocean up and down Robson Street and it was a great location. The food in the pub was also very good and the staff was very friendly and clean and comfy. I used my aeroplan miles to pay for this hotel and I was very happy with my choice.

Reviews.Title: “join their rewards club!”
Reviews.Author: DGA69
Reviews.Content: i stayed here while my mother was at the cancer centre. it was so beautiful it helped me forget my troubles...for a couple of nights at least! i was a little nervous to stay on Hastings St but luckily it's WEST Hastings! the main thing I loved about this hotel is if you join their free rewards club...they give you a 5 pm late check out!!!! i had to ask twice to make sure this was correct. the rooms were very roomy & stylish as well with a semi detached bedroom.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but shaddy internet charging.”
Reviews.Author: Nadine E
Reviews.Content: Nice place - good location. Main issue is that they charge for internet (and don't tell you). I hooked into the internet, used my room reservation name and number for access. I assumed it was free - then noticed an $18 charge on my credit card a week later. For a company so large, and rooms that arent that cheap, internet should be included OR they should be very clear about the internet costs.

Reviews.Title: “Good location - Property being maintained”
Reviews.Author: Dave_S_P06
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel numerous times for business. Check in is always quick and I look foward to my hot chocolate chip cookie upon check-in. The rooms are clean and quite spacious with the bed area separated from a sitting area. The only real issue is the cost to park in the parkade accross from the hotel. Daily rates are quite high and get higher should you chose valet. My internet charges were included but note that this is not always the case.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay after problems at check-in”
Reviews.Author: sdflyer
Reviews.Content: Four of us (two couples)needed a hotel for one night prior to a cruise and found a priceline.com deal at the Delta Suites Vancouver. It was for a two room suite with one bed and a sleeper sofa. At check-in we asked about the possibility of upgrading to a suite with two beds and were quoted a rate of $40 in addition to what had been pre-paid. The girl that was checking us in then asked how many people would be staying in the room and we said there were four of us. With that she said there would be an additional $30 charge each for persons three and four. Our first conclusion was this was a blatant opportunity to get more money for what had been a priceline rate. Aside from that, an issue in itself, we made the point that we had called after making the priceline purchase and were told four people would be allowed in the room. To that, the receptionist asked, "did you call the hotel directly or the general reservations number?" We don't know which it was and really it just seemed like she was using the standard response to diffuse the point we were making. After initially making it clear the hotel would stand firm on these additional charges, the receptionist relented and offered that if we paid for the $40 upgraded room, she would only charge for one extra person, $30. This would be $70 in addition to our pre-paid rate. Honestly, we travel often and frequently find priceline deals in places ranging from Vancouver, a number of US cities and also in Paris and Barcelona and have never encountered these surprise charges and inflexible staff at check-in. With the negotiations settled, she advised that the room was not yet ready for us. This was a surprise considering it was 3:15pm. So we sat in the lobby for a few minutes to decide where to go to kill some time until we could get in the room. After 5 minutes, the receptionist came over, indicated the room was now ready and gave us the keys. Now headed to the room, I reflected on the ordeal and also took note that the lobby furniture and carpet appeared worn and lightly soiled. I was hoping the room would have a better appearance. All four of us were pleasantly surprised when we arrived in our 17th floor the room and found it to be clean, well maintained, comfortable and modern. Its unfortunate we had the challenges and up charges at check-in but overall it was a good stay in a comfortable room. Much to our surpass, when we closed out our bill when leaving, the total extra charge was $40. Apparently they waived the $30 charge.

Reviews.Title: “A Nice hotel, but.....”
Reviews.Author: Jeff S
Reviews.Content: Great hotel. Nice staff, lovely bright, clean spacious room. Clean bathroom. Secure, safe, in a great part of the city. Beautiful Vancouver GasTown just steps from the hotel. However, I was shocked to hear that INTERNET was $18 for a 24-hour period. It just seems so backwards. The room that we were staying in was $140 a night and yet we STILL had to pay for FREE Wi-Fi. I've had free wi-fi in EVERY HOTEL I've been to regardless of the hotel rating. This is an essential service these days. ESPECIALLY if you are on business. AND - if you are a tourist in Vancouver for the first time, the Internet would be really helpful to map out your sight-seeing. Just be aware of this when you book because it's not mentioned on the website.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: LL123500
Reviews.Content: The hotel was easy to find/get to from the airport, it is only a block away from Waterfront station on the Canada line. The staff were extremely helpful. After learning that we had arrived in Vancouver after a 15 hr flight they arranged for us to check in early. They were also very helpful in booking day tours. The hotel location is within walking distance to gas town, chinatown and Robson st. The room itself was large, with great amenities and very clean.

Reviews.Title: “A nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Rachel A
Reviews.Content: Well we got in to Vancouver after a marathon flight from western Australia. The staff were quick and efficient, we even got a warm welcome cookie, nice touch. The room was upgraded with no prompting and was a lovely 1 brm suite. Was very pleased. The room service was nice and they even call you after it's delivered to see what we thought. Room was clean, no bugs, bed was soft. Good rates. Very handy to the city, water front and gas town, well Vancouver is not that big anyway. Overall I disliked Vancouver due to the smell, beggars, hookers, junkies and guns, but the hotel was a nice sanctuary.

Reviews.Title: “The Delta usual standard.”
Reviews.Author: simcon
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights at Delta Vancouver, usual standard expected from Delta Group.Every thing from the smallest detail are immaculate. However to my point of view ,having to pay internet access & self parking is a none sense.Delta Edmonton south do provide complimentary internet access in every room At night there almost no food outlet near by. tne only alternative is a drive to Richmond.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Staff!”
Reviews.Author: hockeyhuss
Reviews.Content: Stayed 10 nights for a convention. A short 10 minute, safe, walk to the convention center. Location to Pacific Centre mall, short walk to Gastown, transportation (Translink) Waterfront station one block to the west. No need to cab it from the airport. Had our 2 young children, hotel provided a crib and there was plenty of space to play in the sitting room. Nice having the separate bedroom too. The Staff was more then accommodating. We were greeted upon arrival by the bell hop, who gave our daughter a duck for the bathtub and a colouring book. The only reason we didn't rate it 5 stars was the lack of a pool, for the kids to play, and a microwave to heat up leftovers we kept in the fridge.

Reviews.Title: “You Should Stay Here”
Reviews.Author: ondbrink
Reviews.Content: Here is the hotel for you if you want to explore Vancouver. The location just outside Gastown is convenient to public transportation (Waterfront Station--SeaBus, SkyTrain and Canada) and all of downtown. The hotel itself was immaculate and the staff were always there, cheerful and excited to help. Try to stay on the Signature floors to get access to the Lounge for breakfast and snacks...super. Access to all floors is by keycard only which made us feel very secure. Housekeeping staff were so efficient as to be invisible, but our room was always clean and the bed was turned down. We will never stay anywhere else in "Raincouver".

Reviews.Title: “Great stay this past weekend”
Reviews.Author: WinterVacationers
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Delta Vancouver Suites this past Friday and Saturday, Sep. 23 and 24. I was attending a conference at the SFU conference centre, to which the hotel is attached. The convenience of having the two right beside each other is great, it allows you to run up to your room for a few minutes of peace and quiet when the opportunity arises. I shared the room with my friend and colleague. We had a room on the 23rd floor, which had amazing views over the harbour, parts of downtown, and the North Shore mountains. Because the weather was great, we really enjoyed those views. The room itself was bright, modern and spacious. The living room part was well equipped with a couch, coffee table, comfy chair, desk and good office chair, and a cabinet housing the TV, fridge, etc. The bedroom had two extremely comfortable beds, flat screen TV and a dresser. There are two closets, which again is convenient. The bathroom is well lit and well equipped as well, and the spacious entry hall made moving around simple. I love that both rooms have windows that open. With the hotel being on a busy downtown street, there is definitely a fair amount of street noise when the windows are open, but after all, you are downtown, and with the windows closed there is little noise. Being on the club level, we were able to use the Signature lounge, which was very convenient for breakfast and cups of real tea. The lounge, again, is well equipped with comfy chairs and a great deck, which we didn't use, but which has great views. The breakfast was nicely done, fresh fruit, the usual breads and pastries, juice, a hot dish of some sort, etc. The staff was amazing, at check in/out, the lounge, and the Signature Lounge. Even though the conference was a busy occasion, the hotel helped to make the weekend as relaxing as it could be under the circumstances, and I look forward to returning some time soon.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Fam_hols36
Reviews.Content: We booked the Delta for three nights to start our Honeymoon (although we were travelling with our 8 year old son) It is a business hotel and the standard of the room and facilities is to be expected for a 4* Hotel. Where the Delta is a great hotel is the customer service, as mentioned by so many other tripadvisor posts. They honestly can not do enough for you, the breakfast chef made a full packed lunch for us in an hour, whilst on his own and in full swing of breakfast, it was not too much trouble at all. The other mention of great service would be Donny, nothing was too much trouble and constantly asked if there was any info we needed or directions etc etc Location is great we walked everywhere, no more that a couple of blocks to most of the tourist spots and only two blocks from the main transport hub of the Waterfront. Loved our stay and would definately book again!

Reviews.Title: “Great location! Wonderful staff!”
Reviews.Author: Professor_E
Reviews.Content: Very nice, upscale hotel. The service was outstanding. The rooms were comfortable. It is in the middle of business district, so it gets a bit noisy from the street. However, if you close the windows, the noise level is tolerable. The location is incredible. It is walking distance to almost everything a tourist needs. It is also very close to the metro station that directly links the hotel to the airport. The only issue that we had was the hotel's internet connection kept breaking down, however, it was fixed after being reported relatively quickly.

Reviews.Title: “Great location I would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: yukonairedale
Reviews.Content: The service is excellent. Room is clean & comfortable. The location is great. 1/2 block from the Canada line. Lots of things to see & do nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Location Negatively Affects Experience”
Reviews.Author: Jaquesspratt
Reviews.Content: This hotel offers large suite style rooms, with separate living and bed rooms. The decor is a bit bland, but ours was clean and sported two flat screen TVs. Many have harbor views, although of a less attractive part. The hotel is between the heart of downtown Vancouver, and Chinatown areas, with Gastown being only a 5 minute walk away. As such, the immediate neighborhood is somewhat seedy. Security is necessarily tight at the hotel. Parking is very expensive and awkward to access. The hotel staff is great. Weekend rates are often a bargain, as the prime focus of the hotel is on weekday convention business.Delta Privilege membership is easy to get and recommended for perks such as newspapers and free local calls. Recommended for those needing big rooms, and for the adventurous not put off by a bit of big city realism.

Reviews.Title: “A great end to our trip to B.C.”
Reviews.Content: If you read my B.C hotel review, you will possibly think that I rate everything as excellent but they all really were for verious different reasons! This hotel was the last stay of our trip and my partner was slightly concerned when I mentioned that it was on West Hastings, as he had heard that this could be a rough area of town. Well it's a long road and I was relieved and glad to say that when we pulled up, his dears were unfounded. The hotel is directly opposite the Harbour Centre, where the viewing tower and restaurant are. It is in a great area for exploring the city and also transport links for the airport from either Granville or Waterfront. Friendly helpful staff, with great local knowledge. Impressive large, airy atrium entrance to building with a decent bar. The suite was huge! We were in a corner room with floor to ceiling windows everywhere. Great view of the city lights in the evening. Very clean, nicely decorated room. Two TV's, one in the first room, that had a desk and seat, as well as fridge. The second in the bedroom. Huge comfortable bed and paper delivered in the morning. Breakfast available but we chose to go out instead, so can't comment. Would definitely stay here again and recommend the hotel. Free internet access in the lobby and airline check-in machine.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money in a central location!”
Reviews.Author: happyworldtraveller
Reviews.Content: This is the second time I've stayed at this hotel and I think it is great value for money, plus you are in a central location in Vancouver. A lot of the good pedestrian walkways and outdoor shopping areas are close to the hotel (such as Gastown and Robson St). The staff are friendly and the rooms are spacious. If staying at this hotel or in this area, the only thing i would avoid is walking down West Hastings street going east towards Chinatown because it's not a pleasant part of the city. The first time my husband and I stayed here, we didn't know about West Hastings street so walking down the street gave us a bad view of Vancouver...but then we later realized that many of the homeless hang out there. Even if you walk down a street or two parallel to West Hastings...it should be fine so don't let it deter you from visiting places in the east such as Chinatown.

Reviews.Title: “Just perfect”
Reviews.Author: penny_lane1974
Reviews.Content: We booked a standard double room and got upgraded to a suite with a corner bedroom with window fronts and a fantastic view right into the city.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: Calgarygirl15
Reviews.Content: This hotel has customer service that is really unsurpassed in all my years of travel. The experience began at the front desk, Cristy was helpful and extremely friendly in a very genuine way. Customer service skills like hers are are becoming exceptionally rare and the Delta Suites is lucky to have her welcoming guests. Our room was upgraded to a lovely suite and we enjoyed the signature club amenities very much. The lady working in there(her name eludes me) was very attentive and made sure we had everything we needed. The gym has nice equipment and was well stocked with water and towels. Overall a great experience and we will definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Very family friendly while being convenient for a conference”
Reviews.Author: MCGKingston
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Delta Vancouver Suites in October 2010. I was in town for a huge conference, and travelled with my 2.5 year old and my husband. We stayed 4 nights. The suite was ideal for us - given that we were coping with a 3 hour time change, it meant we could put our son to bed at whatever time we needed in the bedroom, and we didn't have to sit in the dark. Room service was family friendly for the nights we didn't want to go out. We had family come in for brunch at the Manhattan restaurant, and it was reasonable - nothing fancy, but good reliable food. The service was outstanding- right from help with our little guy when we arrived, to helping us get an appropriate taxi (that could take our carseat) when we left. We had no complaints at all about the service the whole time. As others have posted- the location is great. I could easily walk to the Conference centre. Gastown is close by. We have no hesitation in recommending the hotel, and we'll likely be back if we're back in Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Service can't be Beat”
Reviews.Author: OntarioUpNorth
Reviews.Content: My family stayed at the Delta Suites for 7 nights during our vacation to Vancouver. The hotel itself is in a good, central location (5 min walk to Gas Town, Canada Place, etc), but it's the service you receive that really sets this hotel apart from others. The outstanding service started when making my reservation. It was a bit of a complicated process, since I was redeeming my points to cover the stay. Coco in reservations was sooooo patient with me, and was a great help making sure everything was done properly. When we arrived at the hotel (two months after the reservation) who just happened to be walking by - Coco! We were greeted at the front desk by an extremely outgoing and friendly woman, who greeted each of my kids (all four of them) individually. She then gave each child a 'care package' filled with toys and cards for them - they LOVED it! Of course, next thing you know she's pulling out cookies for the kids and for the grown-ups too. We stayed on the 20th floor which is on the Signature suites level. Our suite was two rooms (separated by pocket doors) and a full bath. There was plenty of room for all of us, and the hotel made sure to send up extra towels, shampoo etc b/c they knew that there were six of us in the room. The room itself was very clean and well laid out - I even felt that it was clean enough to give my kids a bath in the tub (a rarity in hotel bathrooms!). With our suite came complimentary breakfast in the club lounge on the 20th floor. The breakfast was good, but again, it was the service which was outstanding. Sushila (who worked in the lounge) took fantastic care of us, and always made sure we had everything we needed. Again, I can't say enough about the staff and service at this hotel. Everyone we encountered (at the front desk, the maids, bell boys, etc) was very friendly and helpful. They were so helpful that even when we asked for packing tape, they managed to find some and bring some to our room within 5 minutes! I would definitely stay at this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: Ceci123
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for half a week in a trip where I was doing work and some vacation. I really did like this place. It was really close to gastonw a couple of blocks down, two or so blocks up and you are in the middle of where the shops and restaurants are. The staff was very nice and always helpful, the room was always clean, neat and simple decor. I liked how you had to use your key to use the elevators for any floor up, it felt more secure. Internet was available wireless and wired and it was complimentary. Good Internet speed. There's also two coffee shops and convenience store right next to the hotel and on the adjacent street. Very nice! I'd come back here next time!

Reviews.Title: “Nice room and excellent service”
Reviews.Author: VicGuy76
Reviews.Content: Had a wonderful weekend stay at this property. Had an early check-in and the first room assigned we were not happy with. Bob at the front desk took care of us right away and I was blown away by the customer service. We also had a quick dinner in the lounge and the food and cocktails were amazing/

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful base for seeing Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: Paulased
Reviews.Content: Great location, only a block to skyway. Easy trip to and from airport, even with lots of luggage. Free wifi, microwave and mini friidge for leftovers. Great location in Gastown, whiich we liked much better than Yaletown.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT!”
Reviews.Author: Tilly1001
Reviews.Content: Very friendly welcome, and we were upgraded to a suite without asking. Room was spacious, very clean and comfortable, we loved it. Weren't too impressed with the one breakfast we had, but the meal in the bar late one evening was really good, enhanced by Michael, our very personable barman. We'd definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient”
Reviews.Author: Ennea
Reviews.Content: If you want a suite in a good downtown Vancouver spot, take Delta. Not something special, and somewhat outdated. Staff is helpful and cheerful. Talking about helpful: perhaps the barman offering to help figure out how high the tip should be is overdoing it a bit.

Reviews.Title: “Superb!”
Reviews.Author: Fiuluzh
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights in a Signature Club Suite and found it was well worth the additional costs when compared to an ordinary room. The suite was impeccable and delightful - we had two incredibly comfortable queen beds (the two nights we spent there were the only two nights I slept deeply and uninterruptedly during our entire 2.5-week trip). The "bedroom" could be separated from the "living room" by a sliding door. The living room featured a desk, office chair, two armchairs and a coffee table. There was room service twice per day as there was also a "nightly turn-down" where the bed was remade in case you had used it already, a piece of chocolate and a bottle of water were put on the nightstand and the decorating bed cover was removed. We had complimentary breakfast in the Signature Club Lounge on the 21st floor. It featured all the usual American breakfast foods at a buffet. The rather unusual thing was that they had fresh fruit salad with strawberries. The staff at the front desk staff was amazing! I can honestly say that I have never encountered friendlier, more outgoing or more helpful staff. They offered help with any questions or with the organization of any trips. One of them did the entire organization of a harbor cruise for us.

Reviews.Title: “Anniversary night out”
Reviews.Author: ShananiganZ
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Delta for one night.. It was a nice hotel with pretty good location - not great. Parking is expensive but you can save around $8 if you want to park yourself just a short walk from the valet area. I wouldn't recommend this hotel for a "romantic" feel since it's geared more towards people on business but it was still nice.

Reviews.Title: “Very thoughtful”
Reviews.Author: WishToTravelMore365
Reviews.Content: The rooms are nice, many different shapes and sizes but they are clean, modern, and the location is very convenient. My specific thanks to Taryn, who thoughtfully provided a disposable camera for us to use in Vancouver until our camera was couriered (after we left at our hotel in Whistler).

Reviews.Title: “Incredible customer service at this nice hotel in the heart of Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: beefydoc
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed here while on a family vacation. From the valets to the front desk managers to housekeeping the staff is friendly professional and just flat out good at their jobs, making our stay as nice as possible. Especially helpful was the bellhop Daniel who gave us some great advice on restaurants and things to be sure not to miss our kids while in Vancouver. The hotel is clean and comfortable. It was pretty expensive , but I think that has more to do with the going rate in downtown Vancouver than any fauot withe the Delta itself. The Ritz Carlton Buckhead in Atlanta is the only other hotel I have ever stayed in that approached the Delta in terms of their outstanding Customer Service.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Staff”
Reviews.Author: daydreamn
Reviews.Content: Found this hotel on trip advisor. The rate was reasonable, the staff very professional and friendly. The room was very clean and quiet. Location great.

Reviews.Title: “Still a great hotel”
Reviews.Author: SA-skiers
Reviews.Content: We thought our first visit might have been perceived as great because we were all starry-eyed about Vancouver, but this time around proved that even a longer stay cannot reveal any hidden flaws. Again, fine food - especially the clam chowder and the breakfasts. Clean, pleasantly designed suite with superb bed. We slept like rocks. Very nice gym, with fresh fruit, cold water and well-kept machines. The staff were, like last time, friendly, polite and efficient - even the room cleaners were cheerful and fast. The in-house wi-fi was free, fast and steady.

Reviews.Title: “top notch service”
Reviews.Author: chollmann
Reviews.Content: I stayed here w/my husband for 9 nights (he was in town on business). We stayed on the club floor and had access to the signature lounge. Breakfast there had one hot item, and many cold items (yogurt, fruit, breads, pastries, cold cuts, juices). Dinner was 2-3 hot hors dovres, crudites, meats/cheeses and drinks available on the honor system. I don't think anyone could really make a meal for dinner. When there was no food service, there was always a bowl of fruit and coffee/tea/soda available. The suites are a very good size, very comfortable beds and big bathroom. Internet access was free and quick. What really impressed me was that the maid who did the turn down service also emptied garbage, replenished towels, left water and chocolates. Anything I asked for what given in plenty (such as the maple candies). The signature club workers called me by name as I went in--I'm assuming maybe the keycard triggered that? Or they knew after a couple days? The location is great. The skytrain is only a block away, and the city center maybe 2 blocks. I found 2 great used bookstores a block away. Gastown is a 10 minute walk. Taxis were plentiful.

Reviews.Title: “Staff consistently exceeds your expectations!”
Reviews.Author: TheTravelingProf
Reviews.Content: Stayed here as part of a second honeymoon. Front desk staff sent up a welcoming dessert and a signed card to mark the occasion. Had an incident with a circuit breaker blowing and turning off power to the room, requiring an electrician's visit to the room - Delta comped us dinner in their restaurant to make up for the inconvenience. Staff is very friendly and helpful. Bed was very comfortable; only negative was that the sofa bed is just a single-sized bed compared to the double-sized bed normally found at other hotels. Easy to become a Delta Privilege member if free Internet is a necessity. Appreciated having local newspaper delivered to my room alongbwith the Globe and Mail. Overall, an excellent stay!

Reviews.Title: “Last minute decision saved us a nightmare”
Reviews.Author: TreeFrogCreative
Reviews.Content: We work in downtown Vancouver, but last night my step-son's graduation ceremony was downtown, and coincided with the final game of the NHL Stanley Cup series (Vancouver/Boston) and since we live 40 km out of town, we decided to stay downtown, watch the game on TV in our room and then walk to the Convention Centre for the Graduation dinner/dance. Checking into the hotel in the early afternoon the staff were so friendly and helpful, saying what a good idea it was to be staying downtown as with the expectation that more than 100,000 people were going to be in the downtown core for the game, driving home had the potential to be crazy. Our room was beautiful, spacious and clean. We watched most of the game, but as our team was obviously not going to win, we left before it was over to get to the graduation. Part way through dinner we started to hear reports of a riot that had broken out in the city due to the crowds downtown for the game. As it turned out, the police closed all access by vehicle to the city, and if we hadn't booked a hotel we could have been stuck for hours. When the dinner was over, we called the hotel to ensure that we could safely get in, and they assured us that access to their street was still safe. But a security guard was at the door to make sure only registered guests were entering the building. Once back in our room, we were far enough away from the craziness that it was fairly quiet, and we watched in horror on the news what people were doing to our beautiful city. Thank you Delta Hotels for having a room for us, it wasn't quite the downtown get-away night we were expecting - but we were very grateful for the stay.

Reviews.Title: “best staff I've ever encountered at any hotel, except a few owner-run bed and breakfasts”
Reviews.Author: weezeed
Reviews.Content: Don't be turned off by the awkward lobby, this staff is eager to please and they are selling a great product. Comfy bed, well soundproofed walls, at least in my larger upper floor suite. Chris and Zach were especially helpful. The restaurant food was excellent albeit sometimes slow in coming. I don't like hotels, being a light sleeper, but I was OK here!

Reviews.Title: “Just incredible staff”
Reviews.Author: Svevanena
Reviews.Content: Since we put our foot at the Delta we have received the best possible service.

Reviews.Title: “Smart hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: Gordon2112
Reviews.Content: We spent 2 nights here in September 2010 as part of a driving tour of the Pacific Northwest. We picked the hotel due to it's location, availability of parking and reasonable rate. The hotel was easy enough to find off the street, and we followed signs down into the underground car park. In hindsight, it might have been better to stop off at the hotel entrance first of all to off-load our bags and maybe check-in. I mention this because the car park is a public car park for which hotel guests get a parking permit for the duration of their stay. There is NO signage for the hotel entrance inside the car park, and we did find it confusing - not to say a bit awkward - getting back up to the hotel reception with our large suitcases. Reception was professional and friendly and we soon checked in (with our complimantary cookies!). Our room was on one of the higher levels and was very well appointed in a snazzy, modern style. We particularly liked the way the suite was laid out with a separate sleeping and lounge area with very comfortable arm chairs. Our view looked out across the street to the Vancouver Lookout tower, which we went up twice (once during the afternoon, then again in the evening after dinner) We'd heard mixed reports about the hotel location, but we were very pleased to be so close to the renowned Gastown historic area. This area comes alive at night and had a superb selection of restaurants and cafe's - all within walking distance of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Consistently great...”
Reviews.Author: Chapmandala
Reviews.Content: The Delta Vancouver Suites has been consistently great. I've stayed here 3 times in the past 3 years. Rooms are always nice / clean, service is friendly and efficient, food is good (if pricey) and location can't be beat. Highly recommend signing up for the privileges program, which costs nothing but provides perks and worthwhile loyalty incentives.

Reviews.Title: “enormous room, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: divachen19
Reviews.Content: I booked the room through name-your-own-price on priceline, which can sometimes be a bit of a crap shoot. I was therefore thrilled when I arrived at the hotel and was greeted by a very friendly staff person at reception who checked me in and gave me a warm cookie! I think that may have affected all subsequent impressions, because how can you not be happy in a place where the first thing they do is give you a cookie? (Dear Vancouver Suites: I suggest providing some milk, too!) My room was enormous and well-laid-out. There was an entirely separate work area with easy access to the internet (through a cable; I didn't try the wi-fi while i was there). An empty mini-fridge allowed me to save a bit on restaurant bills. I put down only 4 stars for sleep quality because I happened to stay over St. Patrick's Day, and there was quite a lot of street noise when the bars let out. The previous evening I'd slept like a baby, though.

Reviews.Title: “Nickel and dime you, No WiFi in rooms,”
Reviews.Author: emaildbk
Reviews.Content: Rooms and personel were OK. They nickel and dime you for extras and No WiFi in rooms. $3 to print out your boarding pass in hotel business center! Cheap Cheap Cheap! Parking $32/night! no coffee or continental breakfast. Pass it up.

Reviews.Title: “One word, amazing!!”
Reviews.Author: Deanie204
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Delta in January for training for a week. My spouse and our 12 month old daughter came with me. The delta was very accommodating. I have not been to a hotel where the staff has been so amazing. It felt like a home away from home. They actually sincerely care how you found your stay there. I will not stay anywhere else other then this hotel the next time I'm in Vancouver. I'll explain how this hotel goes above and beyond. I arrived there looking to see what they had to offer after being deceived by a 5 star hotel. I have a 12 month old daughter and she will not fall asleep with us in the room so I needed a separate sleeping area for her. Waiting in the washroom for one hour while she falls asleep is not something I enjoyed to do. The delta was very accommodating and let me pic which room would fit our needs. When checking in we had warm fresh cookies handed to us. They gave my daughter a book that she was mesmerized by. They told us they'd send a microwave to our room for her baby food and bottles. I hadn't even thought about it but they did. They thought of everything. The rooms were clean quiet and comfortable. I slept amazing, which is hard for me when I'm away from home. Our daughter also seemed to like her stay. I would recommend this hotel to anyone without a doubt!! Especially if you have small children. Oh and they have free internet!!

Reviews.Title: “I keep going back”
Reviews.Author: Ottawa_traveller77
Reviews.Content: Top reasons I stay at this property when in Vancouver on business; (1) location - close to Stanley Park for running and downtown for easy access to shopping and restaurants, (2) staff - they ALL go the extra mile to make you feel comfortable, (3) rooms and facilities - not the best, but clean, modern and well equipped. Be aware that no matter where you stay in downtown Vancouver the panhandling is an epidemic and like nothing you've seen before.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant rooms in heart of downtown but neighborhood has slight seediness”
Reviews.Author: mimi_bird
Reviews.Content: I loved the decor of this hotel. Simple and elegant but luxurious finishes and drapes. I had a corner view of the city - large windows on two sides. I loved being able to close my bedroom door. It is more like a small apartment than a hotel. However, unlike a true suites hotels, this place did NOT have a kitchen. Only a mini-fridge and a coffee pot. I am vegan and like to cook something really healthy for breakfast like quinoa with chick peas and could not do that here. Staff were all absolutely wonderful. I highly recommend this place but just know it is bordering on some slightly seedy territory. There are cannibis clubs on the block and homeless people in doorways and begging. Parking was expensive $33 per night but I am used to this in downtown hotels. Also the garage is not theirs and not up to the cleanliness levels of the hotel itself. Lastly, the only internet connection was through an ethernet cable - no wireless, but it was complimentary.

Reviews.Title: “Not great ... just ok”
Reviews.Author: c032511c
Reviews.Content: I stayed here during a business trip. I found this hotel to overpriced for what you get. The rooms were much smaller that I expected. I'll probably to try to stay somewhere else for my next trip to Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “#1 City to Live in Canada for a Reason”
Reviews.Author: mahalia1980
Reviews.Content: My husband and I visited Vancouver for a week in September and stayed at the Delta Vancouver Suites Hotel due to it's proximety to everything downtown (resteraunts, shopping, spa, waterfront, night life, etc.). We booked a standard type room and upon check-in were given a upgrade to a one bedroom suite on the Concierge floor which was wonderful. The suite was lovely with views of beautiful vancouver harbour front and Robson Street. The suite was spacious and very well maintained, the decor was modern and fresh looking and very welcoming. The lobby of the property is lovely, the Concierge level had orduerves each evening and breakfast in the am inclusive which, saved us money and was located on a high floor (22nd) with lovely views. There was the biggest seagul I have ever seen in my life hanging each morning on the side of the patio to great us on the concierge floor which, was funny (I included a pic). The service at the Front Desk was amazing, the young lady that checked us in got our a map and circled everywhere she recommend we go experience and tourist traps that are rather a waste of our time. We took her up on every suggestion and were not disappointed in the least. Capilano Suspension Bridge, the Vancouver Aquarium, Stanley Park, Granville Island, whale watching adventures from Steveton (drove us all the way to Victoria on a search for the best photo ops), Rogue resteraunt a 2 minute walk from the hotel (get the lobster mac and cheese, amazing!), Robson Street, Yaletown, etc. She also recommended a resteraunt which we really enjoyed at Granville Island along with the market there. We were recommended by a Front Desk agent the night after a hoity toity resteraunt on the Harbour Front called Aqua which, had great views but not so great service or food and was very expensive. The Front Desk gentleman that sent us there did have an appitizer sent to us compliments of him but I wouldn't return to the resteraunt. If we pay $250.00+ we expect amazing food, great service and great atmosphere. The hotel didn't have a pool or jacuzzi which, would have been icing on the cake but it was lovely none the less and the service, service efforts were wonderful. The last night we were there we ate in the lounge area and although the server wasn't very hospitable the food was amazing and made up for it. When checking out our final day we had a few hours to kill before our departure and the Front Desk stored our luggage which, was appreciated. We did not have a vehicle rental or vehicle when staying at this property but we really didn't need one seeing as the location was great, many tours we booked had hotel pick-up and the light rail transit system was one block from the hotel. We took the LRT to and from the airport with ease and costing about $16.00 there and return, much less than a taxi and the views we seen along the route were lovely. I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, expensive but clean”
Reviews.Author: TekkieMom
Reviews.Content: Good was great one day, adequate the next. Staff was friendly throughout, especially in the dining room. Parking was atrociously expensive and not attached directly to the hotel which was very inconvenient. Even though we paid for a room with Internet Access, the room only had hardwired internet and the free WIFI was only available in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “OK but not great ...”
Reviews.Author: MarvMartSA
Reviews.Content: I was lucky in that I got a great price via Priceline and that was the only thing that made this stay OK. The rooms are spacious with 2 x TV's, one in the lounge and another in the Bedroom.The Bar Fridge did not work (it was empty), so I asked for another one and was given one within 30 minutes. I don't like the bathroom, it looks old and dingy, without us even using the toilet, it was blocked and we had to call maintainance. i was not too happy. Wireless is non-existent other that an Ethernet Cable, which at $14.95 + Tax was expensive. There is complimentary Wireless in the Lobby, but nothing in the rooms we were int. We were told that if we paid an extra $25 per night we could get free wi-fi in a room in a higher level. In hind sight we should have done this. We also had someone trying to kick down a door at 6:30am one of the 2 mornings we were there, once again, not happy !!! Location is excellent however, right in the heart of down-town Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Not quite a 4-star - No Wireless Internet?”
Reviews.Author: workfromhomejohn
Reviews.Content: I booked a suite at this hotel for two night business travel on Hotwire.com for $99/night...total $240 after taxes. The room was nice, and service very friendly. My one bedroom, two double bed suite sufficed for my needs, but the layout was very odd. The living room portion of the suite was tiny and only had two chairs and a desk, plus a TV. Felt more like a weird tiny apartment than a hotel suite. The major disappointment was not having wireless internet. For many, I'm sure this is no big deal, but for travelling on business, I don't want to sit at the desk, plugged into an ethernet cable to do my work. I want to sit in the hotel bed, watching TV and doing work. The location is great, walking distance to all the nice stuff downtown, and across the street from a great waterfront walk along the harbor. I would recommend instead, though, the Sutton Place Hotel. True 5-star accommodations...even closer to Robson, etc., and for only slightly more. You can always find the Sutton Place on Hotwire.com, as the non-suite 5-star option for around $130/night.

Reviews.Title: “No Hot Water -- carpet looked like it hadn't been cleaned for years”
Reviews.Author: Davef905
Reviews.Content: Very disappointing stay -- the room had no hot water and the carpet looked like it hadn't been properly cleaned for years. Dust levels well beyond acceptable for anyone with allergies. Food best described as mediocre. Breakfast service very good. Bar service very poor. Wouldn't recommend this property to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful service”
Reviews.Author: asbd
Reviews.Content: My parents stayed at this hotel Nov17-19, 2010 as part of their via rail 10 day trip from Ottawa-Vancouver & back. I booked them through the internet and they were extremely pleased upon arrival and throughout their duration of stay with the service, amenities, food & accomodations. I had phoned (from Ottawa) prior to their arrival to arrange a welcome wine & cheese platter be delivered to their room and to their delightful surprise it arrived minutes after they settled into their room. I want to thank Ben with "In Room Dining" for the wonderful imported cheeses & fruit platter for your fantastic, friendly & prompt service. I recommend this hotel as a definite downtown Vancouver stay as part of anyones travel plans.

Reviews.Title: “Amazingly well run, friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: SA-skiers
Reviews.Content: By the time we pitched up at the Delta Vancouver Suites Hotel, we were well and truly exhausted. We had been in transit for more than 40 hours and were beyond good manners and friendliness. We wanted sleep, shower and silence. The receptionist took one look at us and changed our booking to accommodate our frazzled state. From the first moment we staggered up to the reception desk, to our last minute there, the staff at the hotel were fantastic. Not in a fawning, irritating way, but in an intelligent way which showed that, no matter what they did, they did it with care and pride and were really interested in the guests. The suite was pristine and stayed so every day. When we took the tissue box out of the bathroom because we had the sniffles, the next morning we found there was an additional box on our bedside. When we asked the concierge for directions to a restaurant, he advised us and pointed us in the right direction. A few blocks later, he came running up behind us, just to make sure we were not lost! When we ate breakfast at the hotel restaurant (where the food, newspapers and magazines were excellent) we listened to the relaxed, cheerful chat of the staff amongst themselves. Sometimes they would come over and introduce themselves, ask how we are doing, and recommend a restaurant, happening or transit route. The night concierge even got on a ladder to help me photograph the impressive paintings in the hotel foyer. Wherever we went, there was always someone giving us a smile and a greeting. I don't know if that is the norm in Vancouver, or whether it is typical of Canadians, but the staff were definitely outgoing and empathetic. After the aggression and tension of Johannesburg, this was amazingly refreshing. The hotel has great free wi-fi and is situated in the centre of the Vancouver business district. You can quickly walk to many of the sights, beaches and hot spots. Just outside the entrance is a handy little shop that stocks most of the things you usually forget to pack. The view from our room was great and we spent some time just looking at the sunsets over the harbour. We slept like logs because the room seemed sound-proof. The Delta Vancouver Suites fits perfectly into elegant, efficient, modern Vancouver. We'll definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautifully clean, comfortable rooms and extremely helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Kitharist
Reviews.Content: We started our holiday in Vancouver and this hotel had all we needed, with the bonus of staff members who went out of their way to be helpful, friendly and thoughtful....offering us the use of an umbrella, for example, when they saw us heading out into the pouring rain!
