The bed was really comfortable, the bath gave plenty of room to soak the travel out of your legs and the coffee maker made a decent cup of coffee, which all helped us adjust to life on BC time. We enjoyed cycling round Stanley Park and even did a bit of a city tour,feeling mildly smug as we passed cars stuck at the roadworks. We also found our way easily on foot to Granville Island, an interesting spot and the starting point for a great day out with Wild Whales looking for orcas! The only downside to our stay was the feel of some of the surrounding area... it would be worth taking advice from the very helpful concierge about where to go to eat in the evening, and where to avoid. We are accustomed to just wandering out and walking around till we see somewhere that looks interesting, but that approach left us feeling a bit uneasy once or twice. Nothing serious, but taking advice would avoid the problem. All in all, an extremely good place to stay, with staff who are actively helpful without being obtrusive about it.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive, no real chance of a view. Better places for less money available!”
Reviews.Author: hlg389trips
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on our last night hoping for a nice relaxing hotel room with great views. We stayed in a studio on the 11th floor and paid $179 for the room. When we got there the hotel entrance is nice enough however the hotel is surrounded by sky scrapers and to be in with a view you;ll have to stay on the higher floor for which the hotel charges a ludicrous $25 per person! The room was poorly laid out, cramped and noisy! It has no Kitchenette so I wouldn't advise stating for any length of time here. Its saving grace is its location which couldn't be better close to the sky train which has excellent links to South and North Vancouver from this point. Its also right on the edge of gas town! Only stay here if its a steal otherwise its an uncomfortable, stuffy and noisy night for a lot of money....

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed in Customer Service & FOOD!!!”
Reviews.Author: JGrant43
Reviews.Content: As a local we chose this hotel due to it's location and proximity to Rogers Arena as we and friends were staying over night for a concert in the city. There were other choices but this one fit and the rooms and beds were ideal. While I have no complaint about the bed and the room cleanliness (which is why people first choose a hotel),,, the customer service has not been ideal and listening and offering customer service. Our complaint was with the BREAKFAST - not only was the food terrible, the service was SLOW. The way our complaint was handled - my thought is now "why bother?" We waited well over 30 minutes for a BLT and Scrambled Eggs on toast. The restaurant only had 4 tables (including ours) so how could they have handled a full restaurant - I believe it had 30+ tables? I could have shown the chef how to make it as it was terrible. When we commented we were given a card and directed to log in and complain... and make our comments known??? We did and alas 4 weeks later here's their comments: Thank you for completing the Delta survey in regards to your stay and particularly in regards to your breakfast experience in Manhattan restaurant. It is always appreciate to receive comments from our guests. It is through these comments such as yours that we are able to monitor our facilities and make improvements to our products and services to ensure we exceed our guest expectations. On behalf of our team, I sincerely apologize for us falling short of exceeding your expectations on this visit, but please be assured that we will use your comments to make improvements going forward. Thank you again, your patronage is valued and we look forward to the privilege of welcoming you again. Sincerely, Randy Burla NOW I ASK you - as a local Vancouverite - why would we choose to go back? They did not offer a discount or incentive to re-try their restaurant? If I'm going to take a chance and spend money eating out - THIS would not be it. Enjoy the stay at the hotel BUT I'd recommend you go to another place for breakfast - about 1 block down is another great / better hotel with way better food!

Reviews.Title: “A memorable stay - Thank you, Brian!”
Reviews.Author: Maximilliane
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed one night at this hotel last Oct.8. It was our 35th wedding anniversary and we wanted to make it a special one. I booked a king bed suite at Delta Hotel. Upon check-in, Brian, a young receptionist upgraded us to a corner suite at the signature club floor which has access to the exclusive signature club lounge. We were very happy and surprised when we came back in the evening after dinning out, there was a plate of sweets (chocolates and pastries) and two bottle of sparkling water beautifully decorated, the bed was tuned down and some romantic background music was being played on the radio. The next morning, we had our breakfast at the club lounge with city view. It really made our anniversary a memorable one. The corner King bed suite (17th floor)has spectacular view of the city and partial view of the bay, the room is extremely quiet, we could relax and get a good night sleep. I surely would recomment this hotel to anyone who has a special occasion to celebrate. The staffs are exceptionally courteous, helpful and competent. Here is a word for Brian: "Brian, thank you very much for making our "day " a very special one!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic and Friendly! Great location too”
Reviews.Author: gorivero
Reviews.Content: We visited the Delta on our kids Spring break and really enjoyed our stay there. They gave everyone a warm cookie as we signed in. We got great advice on where to go from the staff and free water bottles for everyone. The price was amazing, would stay again at the Delta!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in Vancouver, BC”
Reviews.Author: Undecided7
Reviews.Content: We've stayed in this hotel for 4 nights before taking a Cruise to Alaska. The hotel has an excellent location, close to the Metro Station, Downtown, Old Town, Port, Restaurants, etc. The rooms are spacious, the staff --very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in downtown Van with excellent service”
Reviews.Author: mahiwahoo
Reviews.Content: Hotel furnishing is outdated and needs a cosmetic facelift, but, what impressed me most were the staff at Delta Vancouver. They were brilliant. Professional, courteous and anticipating our needs. Will definately stay here again. Rooms are absolutely huge, tidy and clean. As mentioned, the furnishing are rather bland and dated. Internet is only free on lobby.

Reviews.Title: “A fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: Aquarian27
Reviews.Content: We had booked a deluxe room, but upgraded ($30/day) to a better room (19th floor) and the Signature Club (for the breakfast buffet and evening hors d'oeuvres); it was the right choice. The servers in the Signature Club (SC) were outstanding, friendly, helpful, and kept the place spotless. The espresso machine there was my wife's favorite. Our room had a set of sliding doors that separated the bedroom from the living room (not huge, but comfortable). The doors had a problem and wouldn't close; the clock radio had some bad digits. I told the hotel about this the next morning, and when we returned, the doors were fixed and the radio replaced. The Delta's location allowed us to walk to the shore, and to our cruise (4-hour), and to Stanley Park (where we bicycled). We had seen a review about panhandlers, and were a bit concerned. We didn't see any the first day, but ran into a couple the next day, as we headed over to the Pan Pacific hotel. There are panhandlers along the roads, just as in any large city. We loved Vancouver and had a great time. We'd definitely go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at a great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Trader53
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here 4 nights at the beginning of September and very much enjoyed our trip and the hotel. Like others have mentioned the service was great, the rooms were very nice (we stayed in a corner suite on the 11th floor) and you are within easy walking distance of Gastown, sky train, criuse ship terminal etc. We felt safe walking around at night and comfortable with the area although we didn't walk too far east on Hastings Street.. We didn't want to rent a car in Vancouver and this location was perfect to see the sights and have access to the train etc. This was our first trip to Vancouver so we took a few tours and the tourism office was about 3 blocks away so very convienient to plan activities. The hop on/hop off city tour bus stop was about 1 block away and a Tim Horton's was even closer so both very convienient. We also had arrived early in Vancouver and our flight home was 6:30 pm so we were able to check in early and check out late at no extra cost which was very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Thumbs up to Delta!”
Reviews.Author: HopeToronto_Ontario
Reviews.Content: This is my 2nd time staying at the Delta and both experiences were great! The Service is the best! Rooms spacious and clean! Staff very accommodating! Felt like royalty. Great location! Close to Pacific Mall and Waterfront!!!! Starbucks right across the street! I was presenting a Seminar at the BCIT so it was very convenient to walk there in the mornings! Went for a work out and the gym is wonderful, they have a yoga room and fresh fruit! Service at this hotel was great! Would I stay again Yes!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Very pleased with my exteded stay at Delta Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: Janice1998
Reviews.Content: My 23 year old daughter and I stayed eight nights with Delta Vancouver. Being centrally located we were able to walk and/or take the sky trains with much ease. We felt very comfortable walking about the city even into the later evenings by keeping to well traveled streets. The room was great in that I could close the pocket doors to the bedroom suite so that my daughter could sleep a bit longer while I enjoyed the downtown view and morning paper in the living room. The staff were very friendly, very helpful and always willing to offering bonus tips on getting the most of our tours while in Vancouver and Victoria. The warm chocolate chip cookies were a definitely treat after our long days of sightseeing, a hint of home away from home. One thing about the room I did not like was only having two semi-comfortable arm chairs in which to relax and enjoy my morning paper. I missed not having a couch in which to relax on. But that would never denture me from retuning for an extended stay again. In hindsight it was a reason to get up early and get going so to enjoy the beauty of this amazing city. One final note, I read the multiple reviews as posted regarding Delta Vancouver and researched the area extensively, in short I was thrilled with my choice to stay with Delta as I would book again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic.”
Reviews.Author: Calpolpop
Reviews.Content: I stayed there last year on my hols in BC, Delta Vancouver is amazing. The staff are nice the rooms are nice too. In the living room of the suite i had, it had a cupboard with a fridge and a safe which you could make your own password! They have a gym. The beds were just pure heavenly, Everything was immaculate it was in down town so it was easy to get to shops and gas town it is right next to a bus stop what takes to stanley park! (Good for buisness conferences as they have a room for that) This place is absolutely fantastic!

Reviews.Title: “Great location - great price off Hotwire - and great comfy rooms!”
Reviews.Author: urbanwellness
Reviews.Content: This spot is a gem. The suites are spacious, the staff are great, and the location is perfect, right near Gastown, Stanley Park, and Granville street and the rest of downtown.

Reviews.Title: “good stay at great price”
Reviews.Author: John & Carol
Reviews.Content: We found the Delta as a bargain alternative to the conference hotels. The ten minute walk to the convention center was never a problem. Delta's eager-to-help staff and free internet distinguished it from its nickel-and-dime-ing competitors. We had a great stay at a great price, especially so after a complimentary room upgrade.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Service! Nice Rooms, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Bubbly_B
Reviews.Content: We stayed here last year and I forgot to write a review, but this hotel deserves one! The hotel is in a great location, short walk to Gastown and other attractions. The rooms were very clean, a little on the "stiff side". Not plush and comfortable, a little more modern and stiff. But still nice. The service is what I loved about this hotel. Nothing was an issue. We were checked out by the manager who wasn't afraid to do some real work. He was lovely as were the rest of the staff. We stayed with our 11 month old son at the time and the staff were very accommodating and made our stay very comfortable. We took a 2 days trip to Whistler and checked out, stored our bags and rechecked in 2 days later with no hassle. I would stay here again without a doubt!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: mintcreative
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a night in August. Great staff with quick check in/out. Our 14th floor room was spacious, with a really good layout. Firm, comfortable bed and great curtains that blocked out the light for a much needed sleep-in! Warm cookie at check-in was a nice touch :) Great selection of toiletries and complimentary newspaper in the morning. It is a little out of the way compared to some other hotel locations, but still very close to everything and it does help if you know your way around Vancouver a little. It's a few blocks from the dodgy part of Hastings St but we didn't feel that that impacted on our stay in any way. 12pm checkout time was excellent too - we were able to get some morning shopping done before heading back to check out.

Reviews.Title: “Perhaps branded for business, but great for leasure as well.”
Reviews.Author: qqqqqqqq_7
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights after taking the Via Rail Canadian train to Vancouver. The train arrives in the morning and we walked over to the hotel - they were very happy to store our luggage for the day while we explored the city. The front desk agent gave us terrific information on the city attractions and we returned in mid-afternoon to a beautiful suite - a bedroom separated by a sliding door from the living room with a high quality bath. The stay was completely enjoyable and all staff we met were wonderful. I think the hotel brands itself mainly for business travellers, but I recommend it for the leisure set as well. It's close to many downtown attractions (Gastown, Chinatown, and withing walking distance of Stanley Park) as well as being just a block from the Canada Line station to YVR airport and the cruise ship terminal. I would highly recommend this property.

Reviews.Title: “Very spacious suites”
Reviews.Author: Orchids
Reviews.Content: At the time of chekin, they didnt have the king bed suite ready. So we opted for the queen one. It had a pull out in the living area and was overall very spacious. Wired internet is provided free in the room. The room and bath were clean and sufficient. The queen bed was comfortable, but the pull out was a little hard to get a good night sleep on (as on most pullouts for me). Room service was reasonably priced and decent food. Restaurnant service was very slow even though it was empty and the food was ok, nothing to complain about, nothing to rave about. Location is a little out of the vibrant area (Robson/Burrard). A 3-5 block walk to get to other restaurants etc. But vancouver is such a friendly city that we love it everytime.

Reviews.Title: “ok hotel great staff”
Reviews.Author: muttsley
Reviews.Content: i usually look at trip advisor before booking a room but did not on this trip and referred to Frommer's travel book. This hotel was listed in the Frommer book. The hotel is fine, I wanted a suite so my teenage daughter would have her own tv. It wasn't as nice as I was expecting. Floor to ceiling windows but no view. Good location, but not great and the suite was a lot smaller than I was expecting for the price of the room. However, as previous reviews state the staff makes up for any negatives about the hotel. We were upgraded from a room with two doubles to a queen with a queen pullout. She didn't mention the upgrade but I knew from looking at the prices it was a more expensive room. The TV in the bedroom didn't work the first night we were there, at 6pm they said the ENGINEER had gone home for the evening and would repair the next morning. He did and soon after knocked on the door and delivered three free breakfast vouchers to use in the restaurant. Breakfast was great and more than made up for the lack of tv the night before. I thought I saw pictures of an indoor pool on the website but there was no pool or jacouzzi just a small workout room. ALL front desk employees were very helpful with suggestions and maps on how to get around on the public transportation.

Reviews.Title: “First visit to Vancouver - we came away very impressed”
Reviews.Author: Redditchtraveller_10
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from our first ever visit to Vancouver and came away impressed with the city, the friendliness of the people and in particular the Delta suites Hotel. The first week of our holiday was spent travelling via the Rockies, Banff, Rock Mountaineeer, Ice Fields etc ( further review to follow ) during this time we stayed at various Fairmont hotels and became used to a very high standard of accomodation. For our 6 days in Vancouver we stayed at Delta Suites, naturally we expected a lower standard here . However we were pleasantly surprised by the standards of Delta suites. Having read earlier reviews of this hotel I was reluctant to accept an offer of an upgrade on arrival so I just went with the standard room. Again we were pleasantly surprised. The room ( on the 10th floor ) was much bigger than expected, was pristine and has two double beds and 2 TV's - what more could you need for a city break ? What really made the stay was the helpfulness and knowledge of the staff. All restaurant and front desk staff were very customer focussed and keen to help . Particular thanks are due to Melina on the front desk for all her help and useful advice . All in all we would thoroughly recommend this hotel to anyone looking to stay in Downtown Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money!”
Reviews.Author: Kestrel1242
Reviews.Content: My wife and I booked a suite on the Signature Club floor at the Delta Vancouver Suites hotel as part of a trip to Vancouver. These are apparently the best rooms the hotel has to offer and includes access to the Signature Club lounge. When we arrived we were upgraded to an executive suite with a balcony on the Club floor. That was about as good as it got. We were very disappointed with the appearance and comfort of the room which looked nothing like the photo's shown on the internet. The room was small and in need of serious updating. The bed was uncomfortable and some of the furniture was worn out. The complimentary wired Internet access was extremely slow. The room was clean but very dusty, if that makes sense, and basically the whole stay was not up to the standard we expected for the price we paid. The Club lounge offers free continental breakfast and afternoon Hors D'Oeuvres. The breakfasts had a large choice of items and was very good but the afternoon selection was very limited and again not what we expected. On the good side, the hotel staff were very helpful and friendly. We have stayed at two other Delta hotels in the past, in Signature Club rooms, and those experiences influenced our decision in staying at this location. If this had been our first stay with this company it would have been our last. As others have pointed out the location isn't the best in the city but I can't blame Delta for that one! All in all, not worth the money, we would not return and would definitely not recommend the hotel at all.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: Jan2009Merseyside
Reviews.Content: Absolutely loved this hotel. Next to Gastown. What a lovely place to stay. The suites are amazing and have lovely views. Nothing was too much trouble for the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Total Perfection, Amazing Staff, Convenient Location for FUN!”
Reviews.Author: NoMoreSnow_10
Reviews.Content: In town to see The Lion King and have some fun with family. We were warmly greeted and our luggage taken to lobby. Easy super quick check in and then up to our room. Great, bright suite with heavenly comfy beds and lovely bedding, great view of Vancouver. Big bathroom. Two large tv's. Ordered room service at night and it was excellent...pizza, nachos, and cheese/fruit plate with drinks with very friendly fast service. Could hear a pin drop all evening it was sooooo quiet. Room service in morning was exactly on time and very good as well with great service. Check out was excellent....front desk lady printed out directions on Mapquest for me and was very helpful and funny. Every where we went the staff was superior, the hotel should be very proud of this!! You have great staff!! Extremely convenient location if you are wanting to be in Gastown or going to the Queen Elizabeth theatre ( $5 cab ride ). Looking forward to making this our must stay hotel when in the area, which is often. Only CON: the furnishings in the living room are ready for steam cleaning.

Reviews.Title: “Okay for one night, but not blown away”
Reviews.Author: bwest33
Reviews.Content: We reserved a room on the Signature Club floor, the top-of-the-line rooms at this particular hotel, and weren't particularly blown away by the appearance or comfort of our room in comparison to the photos and amenities shown on the Delta website. The room was a lot smaller than expected, neither of us slept well at all on the lumpy, uncomfortable bedding, and complimentary wired Internet was painfully slow. On the plus side, the front desk and luggage staff were very friendly, the hotel is convenient to SkyTrain and buses, and we had a great view from the topmost (23rd) floor, but unfortunately these things don't mean much if you can't get a good night's sleep. Overall, we don't feel that the room was worth what we paid and probably wouldn't stay again if this is the best that this hotel has to offer. As a side note, for those who have complained about the location, be aware that while Vancouver is generally a very safe city, just like every city, there are areas to avoid. It is well-known to locals and frequent visitors that the part of East Hastings close to Chinatown is one of those areas. If you turn right when you walk outside the doors of the hotel and keep walking, you will quickly hit this part of Hastings. If you must head in this direction, it's best to walk up to Pender (or down to Water if you're headed to Gastown) instead, or better yet, turn left instead, walk up Seymour a block or two, and catch SkyTrain to your destination. This same advice would apply if you were to stay at any other Vancouver hotel - Vancouver is a city, so just be smart about where you walk.

Reviews.Title: “Small suite, but excellent service”
Reviews.Author: FuryIII
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Delta Vancouver Suites for a night on a stopover before driving through the Canadian Rockies. Although we reserved one of their larger suites, it was still relatively small, particularly as we were traveling with our two teens. The suite was well-maintained and the bathroom very clean, but the furnishings were a little tired. The beds were comfortable enough. The hotel isn't in the nicest part of town, but it's no worse than the downtown area of any large city, and we felt quite safe walking between our hotel and busy Gastown during daylight hours. We had a nice view from our room, but It was a bit noisy outside at night, even though we stayed above the 20th floor. The hotel itself was very quiet. We were greeted warmly by the bellman when we drove up, and the reception staff couldn't have been more helpful and friendly in getting us checked in and settled, even providing chocolate chip cookies for the family. The following morning, we ordered room service, which arrived promptly. Our very friendly waiter had asked us what our plans for the day were, and appeared back at our door a short time later with a small box of complimentary juice bottles and snacks for our drive, which was a very nice touch. Check-out was quick and pleasant. This is definitely a hotel I'd visit again if I found myself in Vancouver, primarily because the staff provided such superior service.

Reviews.Title: “Not what I expected”
Reviews.Author: love2travel15
Reviews.Content: Definitely not a four star hotel. Location close to the bad part of Hastings Street..tons of homeless people. It seems a bit dodgy to me. We stayed in a suite and the rooms do not look anything like they do on the hotel website. Suite area is old and dirty looking. Bathrooms are outdated. I do have to say hotel staff are friendly and helpful. Ask for free water bottles. This hotel is good for a one night stay or a business stay' definitelynot worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “THE ROOM WE WERE PROMISED, DID NOT GET...”
Reviews.Author: lpjean
Reviews.Content: The delta suites downtown vancouver on hastings/seymour. my husband and i were there for a special occasion we reserveed there best room . when we arrived got the worst room small no view .they would not move us and still had to pay the full amount on our original reservation... the service was very unpleasent ... will never recommened this hotel for any business or pleasure use...

Reviews.Title: “Delta is the friendliest hotel in the world”
Reviews.Author: majelperth
Reviews.Content: By a quirk of fate, I stayed recently at the Delta Vancouver in the same room which I had the first time I was here 4 years ago. And, just as then, the hotel was flawlessly good with its service, amenity and all-round comfort. I am (as my othe reviews will show) reasonably generous to hotels; but the Delta is, quite genuinely, the most impressive I have stayed at in the past 5-10 years. The only one that comes close is the Marriott in Hong Kong in the 1990s: and thatt was as much because it is 'spectacular' and I was a relative newcomer to luxury hotels. Above all else, the Delta has great staff: Delta, I think, has a real focus on staff quality and it shows in the attention to detail and general demeanour. But this is not just an act - they are genuinely friendly people who should be treated as equals and will reward you for it. Indeed, I sometimes wonder whether the occasional criticisms of hotel staff you read here are produced by the mean-spirited arrogance of some hotel guests who imagine that the staff are some kind of 18th century throwback? Anyway, Delta is perfect in this regard. I think what the Delta does right is provide slightly better quality things without massively inflating the price. So, the bathroom amenities are good quality and include all that you would need (two or three kinds of soap, shampoo, conditioner, bath gel, moisturiser, and mouth wash!), rather than - as is increasingly common at some hotels - the bare necessities. There's a profusion of towels, too, all of excellent quality (again, some expensive hotels will provide just enough). Water is provided free of charge, at least 1 bottle a day; turn down service; chocolates; cookie on arrival. What this approach does is say 'hey, we are going to charge you quite a lot for this room, but we will try extra-hard to match EVERYTHING we do (not just the room itself) to the price'. I find this, implicitly, the best way to make a guest feel welcome, and, at the same time, make their stay as easy as possible. We were staying in one of the more expensive upper-floor rooms (deluxe corner view ... well worth it for floor-to-ceiling windows, two rooms) but imagine it is the same throughout. Plenty of space, as you'd expect from a suite. YMMV in a smaller room, but I suspect that the quality is the same throughout, just not the space. Decor in the Delta rooms is, at least to me, very tasteful and restrained - light greens, blond woods, bone/tan colours on the walls and fittings. It doesn't feel like it's been decked out according to some standard playbook for international hotels: e.g. the artwork is actually nice, not just there because there has to be something on the walls. So, all in all, another great stay - definitely recommended. Note - curiously, the toilet got blocked on this occasion as it did on the first stay 4 years ago! These things happen - but what makes me like Delta is the efficient, no fuss way in which the problem was solved.

Reviews.Title: “Faboulous friendly service”
Reviews.Author: 255103John_elphick
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very conveniently located. The room we stated in was spacious and clean. The staff were the most friendly, helpful and accommodating of any hotel I have stayed in in any place in the world. Nothing was too much for them or too difficult. You felt comfortable and at home.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely Quiet Rooms!”
Reviews.Author: cosette13
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with 2 teenage girls who were going to a concert. The rooms are extremely quiet! One thing I hate in hotels are paper thin walls and hearing other people's alarms, phones, showers, etc... NOT HERE! It is so nice and quiet. We had kids on our floor as well, and never heard a peep from them. When walking into the room there is a small hallway, bathroom on the right. Then you turn a corner to the left and there is a bedroom with 2 very comfy double beds and a nice flatscreen tv. Around the corner again is a small living space with desk, chairs, tv and mini-fridge. The ONLY complaint I have is the $14.95 internet fee (why can't these big hotels have free internet), and it was WIRED, not wireless. Also the internet was crappy and sloooooow. They need to update to wireless and just let people have it free or a nominal $5 fee. $15 for slow internet is crazy. Parking here is pricey. $25 to self park, but it is downtown so I expected that. Across the street is another parkade that is $14 per 24 hours, which is a better option, but I didn't see it until after I had parked. Right across the street is a starbucks. I wanted go run into the hotel gift shop to grab some pop (around 4pm on a Friday afternoon), but it was closed. The location is good for shopping/theater/cruise terminal if you need a good spot for that. When I arrived I was given a nice cold bottle of water. Nice touch. I would definately recommend this hotel. I only paid $119 on an off season weekend special.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing service!”
Reviews.Author: Margaritamom
Reviews.Content: OK, it's day one of a three night stay but I've been so impressed that I wanted to make sure that I wrote my review before I moved on to my next destination. 1. Check-in: Speedy, personable, and excellent cookie. 2. Room: Large, clean, quiet, very comfortable. 3. Room Service: Amazing! They went above and beyond to help me navigate around my food allergy. The meal was delicious. 4. Room attendant: Wonderful turn-down service - chocolates and bottled water. 5. Location: Within walking distance of the waterfront train station (very handy for getting to and from the airport for $8.75 each way) plus very close to pubs, restaurants, and great shopping.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice.”
Reviews.Author: Woolywolf
Reviews.Content: Nice room. Friendly staff. Parking kinda pricey but it is in the downtown core so I guess it should be expected. Easy walking to Skytrain stations whick we used alot. Wifi only in the lobby. Cabled internet in room.

Reviews.Title: “It's a place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: homeandaway_10
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself is in a very convenient location close to everything, but it is also located in a place where you feel uncomfortable going out alone at night. Unfortunately, there is nothing that the hotel staff can do in regards to the vagrants that like to hang around outside. At one point I was followed right into the lobby by someone asking for money. My room had an old man smell to it, but it appeared to be clean. The hotel staff were very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “A+ Staff and Super Coofy & Clean Rooms”
Reviews.Author: Moonsoon33
Reviews.Content: The staff at the Delta Vancouver Suites Hotel are, undoubtedly, the most friendly, genuine and sincere hotel staff I have ever met. Every staff member that we encountered during our stay was super cheerful and very helpful. My boyfriend and I stayed here for 6 nights (Dec. 25 - 31) and enjoyed every part of our hotel stay: from the A+ staff, to the big, spacious room with a mountian & water view, to the yoga studio in the fitness centre. We booked our room through Hotwire for a rock-bottom price of $89/night. Upon check-in, we were shocked that the hotel upgraded us to a deluxe king suite (2 levels above the delta suite that we were expecting). Our corner room, Rm 1613, had a breathtaking view of the North Shore mountains, harbor and cityscape. The king size bed was so comfortable and the bedroom super quiet. The bathroom was very spacious and spotless clean. Our suite had a separate bedroom, with a sitting area that came with 2 arm chairs, work desk & chair, along with a mini-fridge and in-room safe. The neighborhood may seem a bit quiet and somewhat remote, but it is ideal. The hotel basically intersects Downtown, Gastown, Chinatown and Yaletown - so the location couldn't be better. We enjoyed superb dining at Steamworks (RB Cream Ale is nice), Salt (superb cheese & cured meats), Guu (order the sashimi salad) and Medina Cafe (fresh marmalade & waffles are a must). Trees Organic Coffee in Gastown is the best for coffee & a snack to start the day. The hotel restaurant, Manhattan, is great for breakfast too. Our stay was the best and we owe it to the staff that take care of the guests and the hotel. Thanks for the wonderful stay.

Reviews.Title: “The Delta Vancouver Suites Hotel: a perfect example of expectations being exceeded!”
Reviews.Author: Peregian19
Reviews.Content: I've always thought that front-line hotel personnel have a major impact in determining guest service satisfaction. The Delta Vancouver Suites Hotel is a perfect example of the application of this line of thought. Great quality interaction between front-line personnel and guests, exceeding all service delivery expectations. The amazing thing is that the hotel regards all employees as front-line personnel, all being empowered to make guest service delivery decisions. I will be a repeat Delta Vancouver Suites Hotel guest!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely a wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: MCPELAYO
Reviews.Content: We can't say enough of our experience at Delta. Not only were the rooms comfortable, but the staff was so incredibly helpful and friendly. Nowhere else have we ever felt such genuine warmth from hotel staff. Even my 6 year old daughter commented on how "nice those people were". Thank you Alison, Nathalie, Rick, and two other staff who's name we can't recall (awesome nonetheless:)). You all made our experience in Vancouver one to remember. Great cookies too :D Other info: Vancouver is an awesome spot for Christmas activities.

Reviews.Title: “Families are Accomodated Well and Service is Insightful”
Reviews.Author: Banffperson
Reviews.Content: All I can say is: great staff: From the houseman who willingly set up the little one's playpen to the chef who was willing to go the extra mile in chopping up our little girl's pancakes over breakfast, the staff here made the stay excellent. The guest services/valet guy at the front, someone from the UK I think, was really striving to go out of his way in packing the car up or helping us out and in all, the front line staff made this a real treat. As a long standing tourism employee myself, I felt this Delta really did exceed service expectations. The only downside is finding this place: better signage off of Hastings St and a revision of Google Maps would be in order. For those of you using google maps....550 Hastings is the SOUTH side of the street. All the best to the management in their successful recruitment of a terrific team.

Reviews.Title: “What happened!?”
Reviews.Author: jpli18
Reviews.Content: Yes, what happened!? I thought this was a nice hotel... Doors were not held at all. I thought all hotels had someone holding the door for you. Especially when you're carrying bags that are heavy and require help! Nope. Opened the door on our own, carried them up the flight of stairs that they had... and then checked in. Checking in was okay. We were so tired. They wanted to give us a map and show us what was around right away, okay. They were able to give us an early check in though, that was great. And then we get to our room. It was quite small, actually. Not what I had imagined. We were facing the streets, with construction, but good insulation paid off. After taking a little nap, I thought to take a shower. But alas, I find hair in the towels. I guess what was good was that all staff were helpful. They were ready to tell us about the local bar, where to go for Italian food, for a coffee, etc. The bar/lounge/coffee place within the hotel was not opened at all times (of which I thought it should be.. people need drinks, you know!), so we had to scoot over and get a coffee. The location was quite central as well. If you intend on doing everything downtown, this is the place to be. But I would rather pay more for service than location, that's me.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, Affordable, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: elektradurkee
Reviews.Content: This is my second time staying at the Delta Suites and I couldn't be happier. All of the staff were so helpful. They gave us excellent directions, maps, advice on where to wander - advice on where to get money out of an ATM that would take our International cards. Good STUFF! Our room was clean and bright and the bed was very comfortable. We had room service deliver a continental breakfast in the morning which was delicious but ridiculous (4 tiny croissants!) That said I'd do it again in a heartbeat. No warm cookie at arrival also - must have been a budget cutback though a sad little gesture to see go. All in all would recommend highly and stay again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, couldn't fault it”
Reviews.Author: jonathang
Reviews.Content: The Delta Suite is ideally located (just up the road from the water front area) - the staff are incredibly helpful and the rooms were immaculate. My only regret was only being able to stay 2 nights in this excellent hotel. Its good value and just around the corner from the also excellent Steamworks micro brewery. Well worth a vist.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional in every way”
Reviews.Author: Rubyslippers999
Reviews.Content: I cannot say enough good things about this hotel! We were upgraded free of charge to one of the suites on the Signature club floor. The room was immaculate and spacious with high quality furnishings. The staff were exceptional- they couldn't have been more friendly or helpful. All the small touches- like the warm cookies on arrival- made this a very memorable stay. Location was just right, within easy walking distance of most locations and right next door to the Vancouver Lookout.

Reviews.Title: “Beyond Expectation, Excellent Location and rooms.”
Reviews.Author: AboveToronto
Reviews.Content: Read all low-rate comments here before the trip, but in deed our experience is way above 4-star. We stayed three nights before and after a week trip to the Canadian Rockies, so we saw different rooms. Both are good, new, well-planned. First room was facing west, several floors above the A/C and fans, but it's okay. There is a partitioned sleeping area, dark and quiet, even has a second TV set. If you're on a business trip, you can call it a suite, because the rest area is big enough to work and meet someone. The second room was simpler, the LCD TV is in the centre to separate the sleeping and living area, but you can turn the TV 270 degrees. The only problem is all the room is facing north, where the people in the elevator to the UFO building (don't know the exact name) would see you if you don't cover yourself. Underground parking can also be accessed from the third floor of the Hotel using your card. One reminder is if you drive, you should go through the entrance on the Seymour Street, not their official address on West Hastings. We'll definitely go back there in the future if we can get a good price.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience”
Reviews.Author: MartheOttawa
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful hotel, the service was incredible. The location was great. I only have wonderful things to say. From the time we arrived to the time we left everyone did everything to please us. We had also stayed at this hotel earlier in the week and again just wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: Livilian
Reviews.Content: Hotel is excellent, staff very friendly and helpful. We were certainly made feel special. Some lovely touches e.g. newspaper delivered every morning to our room. Location is ok just round the corner from Gastown and Canada Place. Vancouver is a great city to walk around in. Just a wee word of warning - hotel is on West Hastings. Dont stray too far along towards East Hastings though. The only slight downsides to the hotel was no swimming pool and the bar closed very early. Other than that this hotel is well worth a stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: ptas
Reviews.Content: v ery helpful staff, luxurious rooms, very very very clean!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, within blocks of ferry, sky train and observation deck”
Reviews.Author: PBlanck
Reviews.Content: We were thrilled with the hotel. Very friendly staff, they always remembered our name. Right across the street was the observation tower. Next to it was a bus/ferry terminal to ferry you across to North Vancouver. A block over from there was a terminal for the sky train. The sky train can take you directly to the hands on science museum at a low price . The hotel was close to great shopping and great restaurant/bars. It was also just blocks away from beggars and a rather dirty part of town, so make sure you ask directions before leaving the hotel if that sort of stuff bothers you. Food court across the street offers great food at good prices as well as a liquor store with reasonable prices. All in all a great hotel with incredible staff! Feel free to contact me if you need any more information.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location, beautiful hotel, great staff”
Reviews.Author: Spudyagain
Reviews.Content: Hotel is located a 5 min stroll from Gastown and the waterfront. Right where you want to be. Staff were very helpful and friendly from the check in staff to the lovely lady that cleaned our room. Room was good, separate bedroom which was nice as there was three of us. A 5 min walk from the aeroporter bus link (despite what the ladies at the aeroportor desk told me!!). Air Canada, Westjet, Northwest check in terminal in the hotel lobby.

Reviews.Title: “The view, the staff, the location- Wow!”
Reviews.Author: Doubleadventure
Reviews.Content: I was thoroughly impressed with the Delta Vancouver Suites. From the time we pulled up to valet to the time we left, we received nothing but fantastic customer service. My children were greeted with welcome gifts which entertained them while I was able to check in and get us settled. The conceirge was full of great information and the room service was very tasty. But the thing I love the most was the view. I had a corner room and the bedroom had two floor to ceiling windows. It was awesome. I couldn't help but sleep with the windows open so I could gaze out at the city lights. I would most certainl.y stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great attention to small details makes this a great customer-oriented hotel!”
Reviews.Author: ATB_7
Reviews.Content: If you've read other reviews, the topic of parking issues has come up many times. I never use valet, but in this case I would recommend it. It will save you from dealing with the impolite ignoramuses that run the parking garage (not owned by the hotel). Also, don't use the parking across the street!! It's prone to break-ins and the advertised $12 a day parking is false advertising, and is more like $29. It is only an option for weekends if you are willing to completely empty your car of anything remotely valuable and leave you glovebox open. The hotel itself is fabulous with very friendly staff! An especially good location if you don't want to rent a car!

Reviews.Title: “Not too bad...”
Reviews.Author: ktown_traveller04
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night. Location is phenominal as you are right downtown and across from the Harbour Centre. Hotel was great; rooms were in great shape and very clean, lobby and hotel in general were in great condition. Liked the security feature of the room key swipe in order to access any floor via the elevator. Staff was not very courteous and generally stuck up which does not bode well for a traveller's experience. Overall though, I would stay at this property again. Parking garage at $27/night is reasonably priced for a downtown hotel...

Reviews.Title: “Amazing staff - great with kids!”
Reviews.Author: FamilyTraveler035
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were traveling with our 10 month old son and were looking for a hotel with suites so that our son could take his daytime naps in one room while we relaxed in the other room. We settled on the Delta Suites and could not have been more pleased. The hotel appears to cater to both business travelers and families, and amazingly seems to manage this two-pronged positioning very effectively. The reason for their success is surely due to their wonderful staff. The hotel staff went above and beyond to make us feel welcome (they even gave our son an age-appropriate book and toy when we checked in) and eagerly gave us recommendations for places to visit/dine/walk/etc. and then followed up to hear about our experiences. The on-site restaurant had a delicious breakfast and the chef even came to our table to offer to prepare a special meal for our son, should he need anything. What a true gem in Vancouver! (And the location is great too!)

Reviews.Title: “Gem of a Hotel, Superior Bang for the Buck”
Reviews.Author: jackson8
Reviews.Content: Really, i was just looking for clean and quiet since I needed to visit Vancouver on short notice. Booked through Orbitz, and the room cost around US$110 per night, so i didn't expect much. I was pleasantly surprised ant the size and quality of the accomodations, and especially the attitude of the service staff. The entrance is actually on an alley off Seymour, and is an easy walk to the Sky Train, ferries, and Canadian Pacific terminal, where you can catch an airport shuttle bus. Black top cabs await. The room is actually a room and a half, two cubes bisected by a built-in storage unit with a palsma TV on top that rotates to be visible from wherever you wish. Local calls are $1.85, and Internet is $10 additional, unless you join the Delta Privelege (free) and stay 5 times. One of the bellmen, Rick, helped me to print my boarding pass and stored my bag for a while after checkout. he made sure I got the right cab, and provided great local knowledge on his own incentive. You can pay two or three times more and not get a better hotel deal in vancouver. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: menehune
Reviews.Content: To begin with, we arrived from East Hastings. As we got closer and closer to the address the neighborhood became worse and worse and we thought we would have to stay somewhere else. Then low and behold a couple of blocks before the Delta suites the neighborhood suddenly, instantly became much, much better. We were still a bit shaky as we pulled in and were unsure if we would actually stay there but the hotel staff immediately put us at ease beginning with Jerrod our valet then the charming young woman at the front who checked us in. When we expressed our doubts we were told that we could safely walk on down to Gas town (that was fun!) but NOT to walk more than 4 blocks east of the hotel. Despite our earlier fears we had fun walking to and around gastown from the hotel. Sure there are a few panhandlers around but not real pushy ones and the waiters at the SteamWorks kept on top of chasing the one away who kept talking to the diners sitting outside. The suite was wonderful, the beds heavenly, we had free internet and complimentary water bottles resupplied daily! The only downside for my 21 year old son was that the sofa bed was not comfortable. I know sofa beds aren't know for comfort but in recent years they have really improved and I have slept on some that were quite comfortable! All in all, we would definetly stay here again and would certaily recommend to friends with the warning not to be discouraged if they drive in through China town on Hastings East of the hotel. Oh on a final note, the restaurant on site is VERY expensive with small portions. If you don't mind super casual dining, there is a food court downstairs of the tower across the street where we ate breakfast every morning once we found it!

Reviews.Title: “A good value in Downtown Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: ottwatrvlr
Reviews.Content: Downtown Vancouver has a wide selection of quality offering accross major hotel chains and some "boutique" hotels. The Delta Vancouver Suites Hotel offers above average amenities, a nice all-suite environment and usually, very good value. The only small negative of this hotel is its location which is closer to the "East Downtown" area than most other "major" hotels (Although some would argue it has a perfect location next to the B-Line bus lines to/from the Airport, Harbourfront Centre, Canada Place and the city's main transportation hub). The rooms themselves are quite nice with a relatively good size and feature a separate living and sleeping area. The bed is quite comfortable and the washroom is also of a decent size. Some of the rooms on higher floors have decent views but with all the tall buildings in this area, it is hard to have an unobstructed view. Although I did not use the gym during my recent stay, the hotel featured a gym with an adequate array of aerobic and weight equipment. The only drawback was to get to the fitness facility which is located in an adjacent building (do not have to go outside). As with most other Delta Hotels, this location features a Signature Club Lounge located on the 21st floor. A nice feature of the lounge is the balcony area with a few chairs and table providing a good view (but not necessarily picture perfect) of Vancouver. The food offering (for breakfast) is quite standard with juices, fruits, pastries, cold cuts, cereals and hard boiled eggs. Like some other Delta location in BC, the restaurant does not feature a traditional full hot buffet for breakfast (It does have a generous continental breakfast area though). Members of the Delta Privilege program who are entitled to free breakfast are usually entitled to what is called the "American Breakfast" (Eggs, side of meat, potatoes, toasts) or something of equivalent value. There are few nicer, more luxurious hotel in Downtown Vancouver but this hotel is a good choice for both the business and leisure traveller seeking comfort, above average amenities and value

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service, great room, quiet”
Reviews.Author: Crissy2009
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the hotel for 3 days and were very pleased about the size of the room. The location is perfect if you want to stroll around downtown. The only negative thing is that you have to pay extra if you want to use WIFI internet in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, not so sure on the location”
Reviews.Author: giddyup_IRL
Reviews.Content: Did not do much (any) research on Vancouver and we ended up here as friends had already booked. A really nice hotel, all the staff we dealt with were helpful and friendly. Not much in the way of facilities but the gym looked decent. Our room was fab - separate bedroom, nice little living area with armchairs. We were offered an 'upgrade to a room with sofa instead of armchairs for $20 p.n. but we declined. If you head NW from the hotel to the waterfront it's amazing. If you head SE along Hastings St (to Chinatown) you clearly have not done your research. Truly depressing scenes of poverty and degradation to say nothing of the potential for danger. We quickly and nervously flagged a cab as soon as we realised our mistake. We arrived in an SUV with a roofbox so we were too big for the car-park. We had to go with valet parking for a very steep $30 per night (self-park was $27) and they basically parked it at the end of the alley beside the hotel. Not really secure and it came back covered in pigeon poop. To his credit the bell-boy I mentioned it to made a reasonable attempt to clean it up. I would probably stay again. Good location for waterfront, Stanley Park and Robson St. Just don't bring a car and dont walk to Chinatown via Hastings St.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it”
Reviews.Author: Travelinwkids14
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel. We stayed here for 2 nights with our 7 and 9 year olds. The reception desk staff were great and even provided the kids with a kids' pack with a couple of games - much appreciated. They loved the cookies. Our room was very spacious, quiet, comfy and clean. The location was great and near the ferry terminal and buses. We caught public transport everywhere - even to/from the airport - and it was so easy with a day pass each. This really added to the value of our stay. We loved Vancouver and this hotel was icing on the cake.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in the center”
Reviews.Author: Orengivi
Reviews.Content: Stayed here during one week. Good hotel, highly recommended, we received great service and support, nice gym, very close to Vancouver lookout

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: BoutiqueHotelFan
Reviews.Content: This is a suite hotel, and our suite was great. Once again, I need to tell you that internet is not included in the room's rate, so if you want to browse, you must pay for it; however, if you bring your laptop to the lobby level, there's a little lounge where you can sit on, and you can ask one of the concierges to give you a daily connection code to connect to the internet FOR FREE!, but again, this is only useful if you are sitting in the lobby area; but at least you have free internet, that's better than having nothing at all!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel--Downtown location is a bit dicey at night”
Reviews.Author: Annie021
Reviews.Content: I stayed here the 2nd week in April for five nights. The room was quiet (as I had requested), clean, and very comfortable. The restaurant is expensive ($30 for a 2-egg breakfast) but pleasant and good. Excellent service from all staff, from the waitresses in the restaurants to the cleaning staff and the people at the front desk. This was my first trip to Vancouver, and I was quite busy: the location was excellent for what I needed. If I come back as a tourist (and I hope to someday--Vancouver is wonderful), I would probably stay elsewhere, closer to the sea wall where there are lots of nice looking small cafes and restaurants. Fast food and pizza for $1.25 a slice was all that was quickly available within 2 blocks of this hotel, and I didn't have time to go far for meals. The hotel is secure, but the general downtown area is sketchy at night--deserted streets nearby. During the day, the location is good. Several blocks away is Gastown, and in 10 minutes' walk one can be strolling in Chinatown's Dr. Sun Yat Sen Classical Garden. The walk is longer--about 40 minutes walk for me, but I'm a stroller, not a strider--to Stanley Park, which is amazing. Again, for touring the location is pretty good; for nicer dining, not so good. The views are of other skyscrapers. Service is excellent across the board at this hotel. I thought the pillows were a bit rocklike, but I slept fine anyway. I would stay there again at the conference rate I had ($129 CA) but probably not at the much higher rack rate.

Reviews.Title: “Do not use parking garage across the street!!!”
Reviews.Author: DBMCLEOD
Reviews.Content: So, our hotel was great. Staff was great, room was great. The rooms appear to be geared towards business travelers, but as a married couple, we were pleased. We drove up from Seattle to have an inexpensive getaway and were very happy with the treatment we received by the various shops & restuarants. Walking from our hotel to and around Gastown/Water St. was mostly good if you don't mind getting asked for change or for one of your cigarettes three times per block. Most of Vancouver is great, but we made the mistake of walking down a small portion of Hastings St. We've been to a lot of cities around the world so, believe me, if you like the idea of a street that look like Beirut in the 80's, than you'll love Hastings St. I would have preferred Mogadishu, at least it's warm there. The city really need to address that area before the Olympics. That aside, we had a great time... until we went to leave. When we returned to our car in the garage across the street, we were less than pleased to find our window smashed out and our car ransacked. This person had apparently cut themselves while doing this and bled all over the inside of the car, then decided to smoke and put the butt out on our floor before making off with the loot(about 73 American cents). On top of that, the garage attendant who was nowhere to be found, managed to find the time to leave me a $40 parking ticket after, yes after, this took place. We called the police, but they don't come out, they just get your info and give you an incident #. The hotel helped us out as much as they could since it was snowing outside and windows prove to be a big asset during three hour drives in those conditions, but then they mentioned that it happens in that garage all the time. Um, perhaps that minor detail would have been helpful at check-in...

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: leilagorbman
Reviews.Content: We got to stay here for $65.00 a night (Priceline), so I can't complain about the price! But I expected more of a 4-star hotel. The room was okay, but had a view of other close-by buildings. The bathrobe (why just one?) was hard and scratchy. The extra blanket in the closet was pilly and old. The TV in the living room was ancient. But, the room was clean, and the staff was mostly friendly and cheerful. The in-house restaurant wasn't bad. One issue: when we arrived, we used the valet for parking, thinking that there was no other option. When we found out the next day that we could self-park, which cost $10.00 instead of the $27.00 valet fee, the hotel was willing to remove the valet charge for the previous day. I thought that was decent and fair. All in all, the Delta Suites were fine, especially at that price. I would definitely not pay the $400.00 price that was listed on the back of the room door. I probably wouldn't even pay $200.00. Great location; walking distance from everything.

Reviews.Title: “Nice spacious rooms & Friendly service”
Reviews.Author: loved1
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Delta for four nights in total arriving late the first night at approx 11pm. We had four in the group so decided on 2 hotel rooms as the price wasn’t too bad. According to our bookings made on expedia.com we were guaranteed our rooms. When we arrived to check in they had overbooked so the room with the king bed was not available only a room with 2 doubles – as compensation they upgraded us for the first night to a suite room with 2 doubles. In the morning we had a tour to Whistler, so we packed our bags and they moved them for us to our new room, they also included a fruit bowl as apology. The hotel itself was overall nice. The lobby downstairs was very flash, the rooms however were a bit outdated (the wall paper and carpet only) but overall not too bad. There was heaps of space in the rooms with a separate bathroom, bedroom and living area, it came with 2 tvs, coffee machine, fridge etc. It was clean & tidy. The staff where very friendly at the hotel, we called them on numerous occasions from our room requesting information on buses times and routes and info on the best nightclub areas, times and prices etc. they were more then happy to help. The location was good, it was across the road from the lookout and only about 3 streets over from the skytrain & all the bus routes and about 5 blocks from robson st – the main shopping street, and about 3 blocks from pacific centre the main shopping mall. There are many foodplaces around particularly pizza places right on the corner that offer a slice of pizza for about $1.50 including taxes. They have a fitness centre which is isnt big but big enough, it also includes a room with yoga equipment/dvds etc and free fruit and water. We paid about $138 NZ per night for 2 people - so about $80 CAD a night. It is well worth this - we would def stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, room, and service”
Reviews.Author: Jen4637
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I stayed just one night but it was great. The location was easy to find and centrally located to shopping stores on Robson St. and easy to get to Chinatown as well. The valet was kind enough to let us know that we had two options for parking our car overnight, either park it ourselves at the garage right across from them for a flat rate of $5 or have them valet it for $27 with in/out privileges at the same garage - we opted to park it ourselves. We parked the car from 9pm the night we arrived and left at 5pm the following day and it only cost us $10. That's pretty amazing for being downtown and I was concerned with break-ins but it was no problem at all. Fiance had reserved the room through Hotwire and upon check-in we were given two double beds and had no problem with changing that to a queen bed for no extra charge. I really like the safety that the elevator to get to your floor is only accessible with your room key, as well as to enter the building from the side entrance. The room was above average and suited our needs, comfy bed and nice down comforters. We ordered room service because we couldn't find a place to eat after arriving around 9pm. The club sandwich was the only item that looked appetizing and it was better than I thought it would be, and they were pretty quick and got our order to us in about 15-20 minutes. During the day we walked around to Robson St. and Chinatown. The walk to Chinatown is short, but there are definitely some shady streets that you want to avoid that our concierge had pointed out to us. We will definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: lindengroves
Reviews.Content: I was disappointed when Hotwire revealed I had booked a suites hotel as my experiences with them in the past have been mixed. My room was small for a suite, and in fact was not really a suite but a room with visual and psychological separation of the sitting and bed areas. But for a regular hotel room it was nice. Excellent bed and real blackout drapes with a valance that kept out the light from the streetlamps. I didn't get the feeling that I had been given the Hotwire room. One small criticism: if a hotel is going to install 40 inch plasma tv, someone should make sure the aspect ratio is correct. The lobby was no-nonsense and designed so the staff could see people entering, and the elevators required the use of the room key. These security provisions are necessary because after dark this isn't the most savory part of town. The location is excellent for business and daytime tourism. I would not rate this hotel quite 4 stars, but it's very close.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, no problems.”
Reviews.Author: CanucksTraveller72
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Delta Suites in January for 4 days. First of all, the location is pretty much perfect. 5 mins walk to Gastown in one direction, 5 mins to Canada place in the other direction. The main shopping areas are about 15 mins walk away. We went to a hockey game on one night and the stadium was just 5 mins away on the skytrain. The skytrain stop itself is just a few minutes from the hotel. A taxi to Stanley Park cost us about 17 dollars, so not too bad. The rooms are a pretty standard fare... quite a "business" feel to it, so no "wow" factor as one reviewer put it, but ours was clean, spacious and well equipped. They're not really "suites" as such... there is a sliding partition across the bedroom part of the room, much like a chinese style screen, but this was fine for our needs. There is a TV in both the sitting area and the sleeping area. Security is good, you need a room key to use the lifts to the floors above ground, and the streetside doors are locked at 8pm so you need to use your key after that time. That makes you feel pretty safe, as there are quite a lot of homeless panhandlers in Vancouver. The only small negative was that my wife was dismayed to see that this hotel places its coffee machines in the bathroom right next to the toilet. Probably not the most hygeinic place to make a drink! We cleaned ours and moved it onto the desk in the sitting area. No big deal really. All in all, it's a good, reliable, clean hotel which is an ideal base for which to step out and explore this fine city. If you are looking for something ultra luxurious, then look elsewhere, but if you want a good deal on straightforward rooms, then I'd definately reccomend the Delta.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, great price, great location”
Reviews.Author: AReasonableTraveler
Reviews.Content: This was our second time staying at this hotel. We stayed for 3 nights. Hotel - Great location, across the street from the Vancouver lookout, one block from the sky train/sea bus station and on, or one block away from, key bus routes for tourist attractions. Tim Horton's 1/2 block, Starbucks across the street :) The lobby is clean and simple. My only wish is that it had a swimming pool and wireless internet in the rooms! The kids got toy packs that instantly kept them entertained for a bit while we unpacked (well, they did get into trouble with the slinkies :)). Everyone loved the warm chocolate chip cookies, too! Hotel room - Very nice updated rooms. Clean, good quality textiles. Great options in the mini-bar. We did switch from the smallish queen bed to a room with a king. They were incredibly accomodating with this request in that they personally delivered the new keys, offered to help move us and didn't charge us an extra for the bigger room. Internet access was fast and reliable. Would be nice to see at least the living space TV updated and some HD channels made available in the lower end rooms. Safety - Good - feel totally safe on this block, and also because you must have a room key to access any floors. Also, we had left some incredibly important documents behind in the safe with our room switch and everything was returned to us in perfect order. Family travel - The kids felt welcome with all of the treats, but also missed having a pool and weren't thrilled with the prospect of the twin-pullout and couch cushions for sleeping arrangements. Other - Room service was very friendly, quick and the food was good and at reasonable prices (for room service). Value - At trip time this room was priced around $15-20 less per night than other hotels when we stayed but I think it was far less when we booked (~$25-75 cheaper per night). It was good to secure the price so early so we stuck with them. We will probably stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms”
Reviews.Author: islandrockin
Reviews.Content: Good clean hotel,decorated well.No wow factor.I liked the facility It is a good hotel to stay at just to use the room to sleep in as far as it is not a resort with not much going in in the way of happening restaurant ,lounge shops.The location is ok,but is close to anything in the city,cruise lines other areas of town etc.Not the best fitness facility.Parking and entrance way is a little difficult.Staff good and attentive

Reviews.Title: “I thought it was fine”
Reviews.Author: quincytoo
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my staff (had 6 rooms booked) for a weekend convention. It is not in the best part (nor the really bad) of Vancouver BUT walk one block either way and you are in prime tourist area. Quick stroll to Canada Place, Gastown. We ended up loving the location! Valet Parking was $27.00, which is normal for downtown Vancouver and worth every penny. Car was right there within minutes of ordering it. Staff in whole hotel were charming and really went out of their way to make sure our stay was good. Suites were large enough as were the bathrooms and beds were comfortable. Elevator had to be carded before they allowed guests to go up and sometimes they didn't work, using after using the elevator phone they magically worked. Internet was a added charge through ours was comped but I think internet should be included in the price, most hotels already do this. I am already planning to return here next year and would advise my friends and family to use this hotel. we all enjoyed our stay. :)

Reviews.Title: “Delta Suites Stayover”
Reviews.Author: blessedmomoffour
Reviews.Content: We were staying at the Delta Suites overnight for a pre-cruise stay. My husband had called the previous day to confirm our 2 rooms for 6 people. When we got to the hotel (about 5 a.m.). they told us that they only had one room. The staff was very helpful, and tried to remedy the situation. They gave us 2 penthouse suites, in which we were barely able to get a cot. I can't imagine how small the rest of the suites must be! The room had very dated decor, but everything was clean. Again , the staff was very apologetic and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Solid Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ottawa_lynne
Reviews.Content: Hotel is pretty close to being right downtown. Close to all bus routes/sea bus. Tim Horton's right down the street but other fast food chains are not nearby. Close to cruise ship terminal (it was $8 including tip) - we could have walked but it was raining. Staff were very helpful and friendly. Explained bus routes, provided rebate coupons, insisted on helping with luggage and provided good advice all around. Provided umbrellas for use when it was raining. There are three components to the room - a bathroom, a sitting room (two chairs, tv, desk, minibar) and then a little room with the bed, another tv and drawers. It's not a solid wall between the bedroom area and the suite area. We booked through our travel agent using anderson vacations to get a lower rate. Free use of internet computer for checking in to airplane. Otherwise it's $10/24 hours for internet in your room. In store gift shop is small and a little overpriced.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location”
Reviews.Author: teltim
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights here. The only complaint is $9.95 plus tax for the internet. Feel now days in a hotel it should be included in the price. Most everywhere I stay internet is free!!! Parking was $26 a day but it was valet parking and it was downtown so for me I found it fine. Beds were very comfortable and overall room large. With small living area and bedroom. (I booked it as a 2 bed hotel room). It is close to shopping and the famous Gastown area. Had a small problem with the bill in the end and there was NO problems getting it resolved. I would love to spend more time in Vancouver and I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sar_hudds
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from 5 nights at the Delta and had a fantastic experience from start to finish. The staff were pleasant and helpful, the rooms clean and the facitilites of good quality. We didn't sample the resourant for tea but had breakfast in the dining room which was acceptable if a little lacking as the morning wore on. The suite was spacious and comfortable as well as being extremely quiet, we didn't see or hear anyone else whilst there, a real bonus! Unfortunately the pool is no longer available as the hotel cannot guarantee the safety of their guests when sharing the facility with the apartement block next to to whom the pool belongs. The hotel appears to be in a slightly dodgy area but walking roughly 1 block in most directions gets you out of that sort of area very quickly. Location also good for access to most areas and right across the street from the Lookout! observation deck I would recommend this hotel for people staying in Vancouver and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel.”
Reviews.Author: teamsmith
Reviews.Content: Our family of four stayed at the Delta on our first trip to Vancouver and loved both the city and the hotel. Rooms are large and well equipped. Food in the bar & restaurant was of good quality with excellent service. Front desk staff were particularly helpful. The location is very good, with most major tourist attactions within walking distance. We didn't have any problems with the neighbourhood as some reviewers have suggested. This is a big city and, regretably, there will always be some down and outs begging small change. The key difference is that this is Vancouver, so most will say please and thank you.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: jeruk85
Reviews.Content: We just came back from a 3 night stay at this property. The staff from the receptionists to the housekeepers were great and very accomodating. The location was excellent. Near the cruise ship, restaurants, and shops. Complimentary wired internet was great since other hotels charged $15-20/nite. The premier room was nice and clean although the Tvs brought us back to the late 80s. But they worked great anyway. We actually switched room from a premier corner king with a single pullout sofabed to a premier queen with a double pullout sofabed. The queen room layout was better for us with two small kids. And it seemed the bathroom was a bit larger too. Parking was a pain since the hotel charged $25 valet/nite. You could save money by parking at a lot across the hotel for $20/nite. But seriously, you don't need a car at all. We ended up using the public transportation without any problems, even with small kids. If you'd like to go swimming, the hotel would give you a pass to the local Y, which was only a couple of blocks away.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with large bedrooms”
Reviews.Author: aboxall
Reviews.Content: The Delta is an all suite hotel so the rooms are large and very comfortable. As with othe Delta hotels I've stayed in, the bed was fantastic. The hotel is in a fairly good position very close to the seafront and gas town area. We checked in late in the afternoon (after 4 pm) and our room was still not available which was a bit dissapointing considering the stated check in time was 3 pm. As the room was still not available 45 mins later we were eventually upgraded to a signature suite.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: tempejim
Reviews.Content: I was able to spend a week at the Delta Suites hotel and enjoyed it very much. The staff was always very helpful, always with a smile and took the time to call me by my first name. The rooms are fairly large, but well furnished and attractive. There are not may rooms on each floor so it doesn't feel that crowded. The bed was very comfortable, the pillows excellent and the air conditioner worked very well. In addition the internet (wired) was free and there were more channels on the TV than I could watch. I didn't eat at the hotel, but the bar in the lobby took care of us the two nights we spent there. The hotel is very clean, I never noticed anyone really walking around cleaning, but from my hotel room, to the hallways to the lobby, it was spotless. I suppose the only negatives is that the TV was on the old side, the alarm clocks didn't work with my iPod and there was no wireless internet in the rooms. I guess I'm being picky here, but if those things don't bother you, you'll enjoy the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: Lacemaker
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 7 nights with our two children aged 6 and 11. We arrived by stretch limo as a special treat for the kids ($48 dollars plus tip from airport, well worth it). Friendly and helpful staff on reception and nice warm cookies as well. Feel the staff should have flagged up that if leaving the hotel from the front of the building avoid turning right on West Hastings and also the street behind the hotel. We did and it was a real eye opener to us. Passing literally dozens of crack addicts and alcoholics wasn't a nice introduction to the city. They didn't pester us but it was a truly depressing sight. Our suite was a separate bedroom with two double beds joined by a small corridor to a living space. Only three chairs so always a fight who sat on the floor. In retrospect I'm sure we could have asked for another chair, however to be honest we were really only in the room to wash, change and sleep - Vancouver is a city filled with things to do. We did try to upgrade to save the hassle of finding somewhere to have a decent breakfast each day but because we travelled with children we couldn't do that as there is a free bar with this upgrade and they don't allow children in. Vancouver is a really great base for a family holiday and we had things to do every day. Highlights included a trip to Grouse Mountain, the Aquarium, water taxi across to Granville market and of course Stanley park. We would have liked a pool but the location of the hotel made up for the lack of it.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and great hotel”
Reviews.Author: brij27
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased with the location of this hotel. It was very close to the Vancouver lookout and harbor center complex. Also the waterfront and Canada place was close. Gastown was a quick walk too. Upon checking in, we had to valet our car ($26/night) which is the worst part but parking in Vancouver is very expensive. This includes in and out privileges. The check in process went smoothly and the receptionists were very pleasant. The room was nice overall. Nicely decorated with a living room like area with TV, sofa, desk, elegant desk chair, minibar. We had to order a refrigerator separately for our things. The bathroom was nice too and very clean. The bedroom was separated by a sliding door from the rest of the area making it a more private space and giving it more a suite feel. I really thought this concept was innovative. The door had frosty glass and it looked very modern. The bedroom has nightstands on both sides and a TV. The bed is very comfortable too. We loved the location and the friendly service. For the price we paid on Priceline, this hotel cannot be beat and gets 4 stars.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent base for exploring Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: djo53
Reviews.Content: We started our driving tour of BC at Vancouver and having carefully looked over the reviews, we decided to stay at the Delta Vancouver Suites. We were not disappointed. The property is modern and in a very good condition in terms of decor, maintenance etc. Whether you would describe our room as a suite would depend on what you expect a suite to be.
