We are not aware that we were upgraded but we got a very nice 'suite' on the 8th floor which comprised a spacious bedroom with two of the four walls being full height windows. Through a sliding glass door was a second equally spacious lounge/workspace. GIven that we were looking for comfortable, quality well located accomodation from which to explore Vancouver, we were more than satisfied. The staff were polite efficient and helpful. We took breakfast each morning in the hotel restaurant and found it to be excellent. We felt that detrimental references in previous reviews to the presence of 'down and out's and to the neighbourhood in which the hotel is located were hugely exagerated and the reader should not be detered from selecting this hotel by these reviews. The hotel's location is absolutely fine - no problem at all, in fact it is ideally situated to explore Gastown and Downtown. On our first night we asked the concierge if there were any areas we should NOT stray in to. There was, but with a very ample buffer between it and the hotel it was not a problem and we felt entirely comfortable walking out at night. As in any major city there are homeless and beggers and Vancouver has no more than its fair share. If your choice is to ignore them they won't, in our experience, bother you. For dinner we highly recommend Water Street Cafe in Gastown. Vancouver is a fantastic city to visit. We recommend a 'hop on, hop off' bus tour. Be sure you hop off at Granville Island as this is in the 'must not miss' category. While you are there, buy lunch from the Public Market and take it to a waterfront seat and enjoy the view and the food. Spend time at Canada Place (the cruise ship terminal) and stroll down the waterfront towards Stanley Park. Be sure also to visit Grouse Mountain and take the gondola to the top. You could walk (the Grouse Grind) if you feel energetic. All in all, a very enjoyable stay in a well above average hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth an upgrade, but OK overall”
Reviews.Author: BWUK
Reviews.Content: When travelling with my mum, I decided to upgrade to a superior room on the 14th floor, a 'closed-style' suite, which had separate bedroom and living areas. The presentation of the hotel is great - the lobby is very open and looks modern, the breakfast and restaurant area is pleasant, with windows overlooking the street. Staff are attentive and very polite, and many took the time to talk at length with us about our trip... the food is also very good. However, for the extra money I paid, I expected alot more. The room was very small, with a weird dark corridor between the bedroom and living area. The decor was modern, but a little cheap and sometimes scruffy. Wall papering and easy-chairs could be nominated for a length of service award! It was a good hotel, but I wish I hadn't upgraded. I should have also booked through a discount website. The most expensive hotel of our trip, but not the best.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable 2- night stay”
Reviews.Author: michele928
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I decided to stay at the Delta Vancouver Suites after reading reviews on TA. At first we had a little trouble finding the parking entrance to the hotel. We saw the building (located on a slightly busy, one-way street) and passed the small sign for valet parking. Once inside, check-in was easy, staff was very friendly, esp. the valet attendants. We actually upgraded our room (23rd floor) which included free internet access, 24 hr access to a lounge w/ free beverages (bottled water, juice, soda - so we didn't have to use the costly minibar), free breakfast til 10:30am (fruit, pastries, eggs, coffee/cappucino, etc.), and evening appetizers/drinks (which we didn't take advantage of). Room was clean, about average size, w/ a separate sitting area w/ a desk and TV. The bedroom had a flat screen TV, w/ heavy curtains (for those who like to sleep in!), though walls were pretty thin and can hear people passing through the hallway, bed and pillows were also very comfortable. The location of the hotel was good. Short drive to Robson St (great for people watching, shopping & eating!), Granville Island (nice market w/ lots of food choices - try the Buffalo Pepperoni, sooo good and this is coming from someone who isn't much of a meat person, also had good bread, fruit, etc!!) Stanley Park (we brought our food here, but was a little cold/cloudy when we went, huge park!), Grouse Mountain (did the 8 minute ride to the top - NICE views!) and Capilano Suspension Bridge (a little farther, also nice views). Room service was a bit pricey ($8 USD for a smaaall slice of chocolate cake, plus $4 service charge). We stayed in most nights and watched a couple movies ($13.99 each!) Overall a comfortable stay, would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: will5404
Reviews.Content: I got this hotel on Priceline for $144/night (Prices were higher due to the Vancouver International Marathon being in town). This hotel has a very good location, it's a very short walk to Waterfront station which hooks you into the West Coast Express/Sea Bus/SkyTrain etc. I personally came in by train, so I was able to take the SkyTrain from Pacific Central station to the hotel for $2.50. Checkin was very good, staff were very friendly and polite. I was offered an upgrade for $30/night, but declined it and still ended up with a very nice room. I'm not sure I would call it a suite, it's not significantly bigger than your average hotel room, just has a separate room with a bed/tv and a livingroom. Since I was traveling alone, the size of the room wasn't a big deal anyways. The house keeping staff was good, got a free paper in the morning hanging on the door. Overall I would stay again, but I still have a preference for the Hyatt (the only other Vancouver hotel I've stayed in).

Reviews.Title: “Good Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: PrincessZeltron
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for one night and it was a great place to stay. It was right downtown within walking distance to interesting sights, restaurants and the water. It was close to the main office for the Big Bus Tour company in case you're looking for a great way to see the city. It also felt really safe to be walking around there alone. The only reason I've given this hotel an average rating is because I didn't try the restuarant or the other hotel amenities. The room was nicely laid out, the bed was very comfortable, nice robe and toiletries in the bathroom. The room was clean and quiet and the newspaper was outside my door in the morning. It was exactly what I was looking for and I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great service and touch”
Reviews.Author: PAR1BC
Reviews.Content: The staff were wonderful. They really went out of their way to make sure that we got good service. They would run to open the door for you. The linen and beds were top notch. The best touch of all was the warm cookies that they give out when checking in!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place!”
Reviews.Author: charolais
Reviews.Content: We just returned home and wanted to say what a great hotel. It was quiet and very comfortable. We loved that it was in close walking distance to many places in downtown Vancouver. We really like the Executive experience and will do it again. We highly recommend a stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel In A Beautiful City”
Reviews.Author: SHFT54
Reviews.Content: The Delta was just what we needed. A large, clean room, for a good price in a central location. The room was very big by hotel standards but I'm not sure I would classify it as a full suite, as it lacks a true living room area. Has two chairs instead of a couch. The beds were very comfortable with decent pillows. The staff was awesome. It being our first time in vancouver we had many questions which they not only answered but gave us customized answers to our specific wants a needs. We rented a car and altough very convnient and cheap for the area, there is a $26/day fee for valet(unlimted in and out makes this offer a steal though).

Reviews.Title: “Overrated”
Reviews.Author: nononesense
Reviews.Content: Priceline listed this hotel as 4*. It should be only 3* or worse. Other 3* hotels could have been better than this one. Though the staff was very friendly, the room was very small - a noisy and busy street (W Hasting). We couldn't sleep. It is just only a few blocks from the "crackheads" area. We were chased by a bunch of beggars. You will hear these phrases a lot while walking around, "Excuse me, Sir. I'm not living on the street, but I need some change to help me getting a bus ticket to go home." or "Excuse me, Sir. I have a job, but I need your help..." Blah...blah...blah... After helping a few of them, we were like... "Okay, that's enough!" Be wared, there is a lot construction around the town and next to the hotel. On top of everything, the parking was very expensive. We got in at 3:00 PM and check out the next day at 9:00AM. It cost us a shocking $33 parking fee. Ouch! Overall, we wouldn't want to stay here ever again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Delta!”
Reviews.Author: tripchick29
Reviews.Content: This hotel is across the street from the Top of Vancouver revolving restaurant (only round tower in Vancouver if you are trying to find this hotel by driving into town). It is a very modern all suites hotel that even has a 13th floor (where we stayed). It's about 3~4 blocks down from the "main drag" and all the central shopping and entertainment. Everything was as advertised--spacious suite type room. Business desk, large bathroom, 2 comfortable double beds. All furniture was quite new and the room was decorated in bright, modern colours. My only "complaint" about this room, and it is minor, is that the sitting area did not have a sofa and coffee table. My room had 2 smallish chairs beside the business desk and chair. This was a small disappointment, but definitely not a problem for me. The hotel offers valet parking at a fee $25.00 and there is a self-parking parkade ($15.00/day). However, the parkade and the hotel are NOT connected by elevator, making it cumbersome to drag suitcases and shopping bags from the car to the hotel. Furthermore, to enter the parkade on foot from the hotel, you need to walk through the same entrance as where the cars drive--again cumbersome if you have a lot of luggage. The Manhattan restaurant inside the hotel had some wonderful and interesting breakfast dishes. Although it was expensive, it was different and in my eyes, worth the money. For those not familiar with Vancouver, for most activities it is best to walk up the street (away from the water) from the hotel and to stay to the west side of Hastings St. If you walk a mere 3 blocks to the east, you will see the down and out side of Vancouver. There are a great deal of homeless people and with that also comes drugs/alcoholism and petty crimes. I would definitely stay at this hotel again. It was an excellent experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at Delta Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: Pogo15
Reviews.Content: Well done to the people at Delta Vancouver Suites Hotel. We stayed one night in Jan 08 before traveling on to Whistler and had the best experience. The service was excellent, just the right mix of professionalism and casual and genuine friendliness. We had been in transit from Australia for over 30 hours and from when we arrived we were very well looked after and made to feel welcomed. We even got an upgrade to a Signature Club suite, I think this was because we looked so pathetic and tired - I nearly cried when we entered our suite - very lovely, spacious, with a gorgeous view. With the upgrade, we were given access to the Signature Club breakfast room which was lovely and had a great complimentary breakfast. Here again, the staff were superb and we were looked after by a lovely lady who not only treated us like guests in her home but who we openly chatted to us about her life and ours, it was excellent. The Signature Club is definitely worth paying for if you are considering it. I can't recommend this place strongly enough if you like staff who are professional but still human, friendly and genuine.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: roadwarrior101
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel online at Hotwire.com for three nights for $99 per night. It seemed like a steal and the hotel didn't dissapoint. It is beautiful and the corner suite we got gave a bit of a luxury feel. For those not familiar with Delta Hotels, it is very much like a Westin, which is a good thing. For parking, save yourself some money and do self parking ($15 on weekends and $25 during the week, as opposed to $30 + tip for valet). The bed was very comfortable (again like a Westin) and they even gave us chocolate chip cookies upon our entry. The only thing I didn't think was wonderful was that it sort of borders a rough area of Vancouver (there was a double homicide a block from the hotel while we were there). Still, if you keep your wits about yourself, you can always walk to the nice areas like Yaletown and save yourself a bunch of money.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay Delta Suites Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: blackcherry115
Reviews.Content: Like previous reviews, the area is a bit dodgy but having said that this hotel is in a convenient area of vancouver close to all amenities, buses, shops, sea bus etc. Our suite on the 14th floor had a great view across the water towards the mountains. the suite itself was brilliant, plenty of room, comfortable, huge bathroom. All the staff were friendly, very helpful and made our stay one to remember, we cannot fault this hotel for the price it was great. Vancouver is a great city with lots to do for everyone, it has an excellent transport system easy to get around all the atractions. We went to the xmas lights at vanusen gardens which were lovely weve never seen so many lights! Grandville market was a good place to pass a couple of hours. We used the transport with a day ticket/pass costing $8 each from the machines near sea buses which was excellent value, we went across the water on the seabus upto Lynne canyon on a bus, then up to capilino suspension bridge and back across the water again all for the day ticket (if you get your ticket early enough you could use it even more and it would be better value still). All in all we had a great time in vancouver a good all round city and we would go back again with out a doubt.

Reviews.Title: “Great Rooms Downtown”
Reviews.Author: cvhdvd
Reviews.Content: After we moved from the Delta Airport this was much better. My room was a suite with a separate bedroom/living room with couch. Make sure you ask to stay on the 10th floor or higher as they are semi-premium with free internet and turndown service. You have to ask for them and they should not cost any more than the lower rooms. Lots of college kids down town so you can walk around the block and get some food cheap. Slice of pizza was $1.50. If you want a nice meal walk about three blocks and stop by Steam Works. Lots of other pubs nearby. Parking is VERY expensive, be prepared for $25.00 a day. The airport is about a 30min drive depending on traffic.

Reviews.Title: “Well Situated”
Reviews.Author: TravelAdviceCA
Reviews.Content: The Delta Hotel is well situated in the Vancouver area, in walking distance to many of the sites and quickly accessible to the sea bus as well as the tram and buses. The suites we occupied on the tenth floor was well appointed with a small reception area as well as a seperate bedroom. The bedroom window has a view of a dingy interior courtyard but the view from the living room was quite nice. The hotel uses a key card system for the elevator keeping unwanted guests from entering your floor easily. The reception desk is a set of three round desks each with someone to help you. The personel was helpful and attentive. Serving a welcome cookie when you arrived and arranging for luggage storage if you arrive before your room is ready. The location is good. There are several reasonably priced restaurants in the area as well as a Tim Horton`s and a Seven-Eleven should you need either. There are two pharmacies within a two block area. Remember to look around on a price as the price varied widely on may different sites.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: leobugman
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 hights post Alaska cruise in September 2007. Found the hotel to be quiet, (stayed on the 23rd floor), very clean and comfortable. Enjoyed the complimentary breakfast and hors d'orvs, plenty of food avialable for both when we stayed there. Good location for the Vancouver transport systyem. Will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but noisy”
Reviews.Author: gd78
Reviews.Content: Spent a week in this hotel. Our suite was very comfortable but quite noisy becouse of the traffic downtown (windows glasses were not so think indeed)...Breackfast was very good (and free) in signature club, BUT you had to had it before 8 am otherwise almost nothing was still available.

Reviews.Title: “great staff”
Reviews.Author: herchar
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a week in British Columbia. The Delta hotel is modern and we have experience a very good service . We were surprise about the food, the breakfast is lovely with cheeses fruit pastries etc. The pool is to small , but our children found it ok. The room was perfect...for our family. We had two connecting rooms and both had a small t.v. room apart. A lot of space and privacy.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location!”
Reviews.Author: fwtexastraveller
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a five-day vacation stay at this hotel. It's a great hotel, in a great location, in a great city. The rooms have a standard upscale feel, with great finishes and wonderful views of the city. In August, you can open up the windows and enjoy the cool breezes. Every room is a suite, which makes it a great stay if you have kids. Some of the rooms have pullout sofabeds. Ours did not, but the extra space for the reasonable price ($220 Canadian) was a nice stress reliever. The hotel is just steps off Canada Place and the historic Gastown district, with its restaurants and shops, and is an easy walk from Chinatown. It's also a block away from Hastings Street, which is so run down it's even labelled as "troubled" by the tour books. Delta's a chain, but the staff treats you as if this were a boutique operation. The concierges and other desk staff are knowledgeable on Vancouver directions and restaurants. (They consistently asked us where we were setting off to each day, and they followed up our answers with directions.) By the second day, one of the valets (Terry) was addressing us by name. The business center is open 24 hours and is accessible by room card key. The internet is free, but there are only two PCs and the traffic is heavy in the mornings. We tried the hotel restaurant only for the breakfast buffet, which was standard by offerings and price. We ordered off the breakfast menu a few times, and the food was unusual and terrific. The hotel also has a nice indoor pool, whirlpool, and sauna, with locker rooms, showers, and an adjoining rooftop deck for sunbathing.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at Delta Vancouver Suites Hotel”
Reviews.Author: dtanzen
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Delta Vancouver Suites was wonderful. The staff was friendly and very helpful. The beds were super comfortable. I highly recommend this hotel. The location was also great. It was walking distance from most attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Pricey but no major complaints”
Reviews.Author: kisstina
Reviews.Content: Location is great but rooms are pricey for what it is. Beware the "non-smoking" room. We requested a non-smoking room but got one on a smoking floor. The room didn't smell like a Vegas room, but if you can't stand even the slightest scent of smoke, request a room on a non-smoking floor. The hotel staff was very hospitable and moved us into a another room promptly. The room itself was clean but small. Instead of a queen size beds, rooms are furnished with doubles. Valet was a nightmare - the hotel entrance is in an alley and parking to wait for valet was almost impossible. We had to circle the hotel thrice before we could find a place to leave our car. All in all, I have no major complaints. But I would venture elsewhere the next time in Vancouver, the Four Seasons is $10 cheaper/night.

Reviews.Title: “Helpful Staff”
Reviews.Author: Tazmaniac
Reviews.Content: What on earth is Worldtraveler027 from California talking about? Talk about waffle... My wife and I have just arrived home from our stay in Vancouver when we stayed at Delta Suites. I have stayed at many hotels during the year and I found the reception area one of the most welcoming and informal, yet efficient you could wish for - bribing me with cookies on my arrival has nothing to do with this review being great!! The staff were more than helpful, giving quick and accurate answers to my questions of best places to catch buses to various parts of town and where to eat etc. We booked one of the Signature rooms on the upper floors of the hotel which allowed you a complimentary breakfast in the Signature Lounge on the 22nd floor. Here we were made very welcome by Lorraine who chatted to us about our holiday. The bedroom was large, with a lounge area and efficient air conditioning - much needed as Vancouver had ordered us a heat wave for our stay! The matress cover and pillows gave me one of the best nights sleep I had had in a hotel for a long time. The rooms were clean and staff encouraged recycling of towels, newspapers and bottles. Our flight home was late in the day, so without any fuss we were allowed to keep our room until beyond checkout, then after leaving our cases with the more than helpul doormen, we were given a key to the signature lounge, where we stayed until the time of our departure. As you may gather, unlike other reviewers...., I have nothing but praise for this well located, well run hotel. I WILL BE BACK.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Serivice, Mold in Bath, Bedroom caked in Dust, no heat, dangerous area”
Reviews.Author: WorldTraveler027
Reviews.Content: Filthy rooms, bedrooms caked in dust as if they hadn't bothered in years to be cleaned await those who check-in to this property. The Suites are horribley small, and are not true suites. Regular Rooms are simply one room with a cheap partion, with an area that has an ottoman chair. We complained and paid 30 bucks to upgrade to a 'premium' Suite, which was still not a standard hotel suite, again a room with a partion that was broken and didn't close all the way, and left two feet gap between the cieling and and again a cheap thin partition. Amazing these guys call themselves a Suites hotel. Maybe they should go and at least look at a hotel like any Embassy Suites (which are far far superior), or for that matter the Pacific Palisades Suites in Vancouver itself. I was amazed that an earlier posting someone wrote that the Fairmont Group owns the Delta chain, what a stain on their reputation for running such a dump as this hotel, two years ago we stayed at there Hotel Vancouver and Empress in Victoria, I wish the could bring the same high standards to their Delta subsidary). We usually stay at the Palisades (part of the superior Kimpton Group) which has huge full suties and a lovely pool area. The Delta's Pool requires a huge hike to get to, where you find a filthy pool and spa, both with thick black growths of mold growthing on them. The Delta seems to think mold is in fashion or something. Our bathroom and tub and bathroom tileing had disgusting growths of black mold. The Delta has a placard in there bathrooms saying that they guarentee clean rooms, or your first night is free. This is a claim they do not honor and is silly for them to have anyways. Why dont they act like there compitiion and just offer a clean room each and everytime as a matter of professionalism and normal cleanlyness in the hospitaltiy industry. As a owner of several apartment complex's in California, the health department here would never let a property open their pool area with the gross mold they have growing everywhere. Avoid the gym as well, or you are likely to leave with a staph infection or catch some other virus. We returned in the evening to our room having found the maid, who again failed to clean the mold and dust in our room had turned the Air Conditioning on FREEZEING, at least she left a a mint by the pillow, a Claritin for alleriges would have been more appropriate for those allerigic to mold and dust. Upon going to bed I turned up the heat since the room was so cold. A couple hours later the room was still freezing so I turned on it top heat. The heater alas was broken and needed serviceing and 3 A.M. in the morning I had to call the hotels maintaince department to fix the heat in our room. After waiting close to an hour the maintaince man finally came, another hour for him to fix it. He told me this happened 'all the time' after the A/C had been on, that since they recylce the air, the heater gets full of water and has to be drained. I had enough, I went to the hotel's "business center' to reserve a Suite at the Palisades (for a cheaper price and superior product). By the way, the 'business center' had three computers, but only one worked. It made me wonder if anything worked in this property. Luckly the Palisades had room for our next three nights we where spending in town. What a relieve to be able to get out of this property . Amazingly upon checking out we found the check-out staff aincredibly unproffessional and rude. It was if the women who checked us out named 'Chi-Chi' was experienceing her first day at work or maybe was sent from a Temp Agency to fill in for the day. Though she had a record of filthy room we got, she knew of the mold in their pool, -as she informed us they share it with the condo complex next door, and the hotel was 'pondering' closing "their" pool as the condo complex regularly leaves in uncleaned with mold and bacteria and who knows what. We informed her that if their own hotel cleaning staff was incapable of cleaning the mold in around the batthtubs in the room, the pool would still be the same. Anyways Chi-Chi, said there was nothing she could do as we had booked our room through Hello-B.C. , which is part of the province's Tourism department, and thus could not honor their policy gurarentee of a clean room or hotel facilities, but she was happy to throw in her totally rude and unprofessional service for free! I have written to Delta's "we listen" customer service department but have recieved no reply so far and it has been over six weeks now since our stay. Lastly, this is hotel is located in Vancouvers worst nieghborhood, Gastown is full of filth and drug addicts. The hotel purposely Locks its front enterance on Hastings St. for security. Thus you must enter the hotel through the garage breezeway to get into the hotel at night. Do yourself a huge favor and stay in a safer neighborhood, like in Yaletown or on or near Robsin Street, i.e. like the Pacific Palisades where your are close to shopping, restarurnats and nightlife, the dodgey neighborhood of the Delta offters none of this come the weeekend when the area is deserted. I could right more on our horrible experience at the Delta and its lack of a response of our letter to their customer service department. Vancouver is a beautiful city as we found out once we moved hotels, don't ruin your vacation by staying in this filthy hotel or its filthy neighborhood.

Reviews.Title: “I wish we had this chain in America!!”
Reviews.Author: esjones
Reviews.Content: We picked this hotel after reading several positive reviews from this website. So, so glad that we did! Upon arrival, the sweetest lady greeted us (I believe her name was Allison) with warm, delicious chocolate chip cookies. While checkin in, our new friend at the front desk quickly upgraded our room from the 5th floor to the very top club level -- all because we had just gotten engaged! Very generous, very unexpected and very appreciated! THE ROOMS are clean and comfortable. The bed is fantastic, the television choice is large, free internet, fantastic shower water pressure, quality bath products, incredible towels, wonderful natural light AND they encourage recycling!! THE NEIGHBORHOOD is okay. There is a college across the street so lots of kids hanging around and the cruise ships dock a couple blocks away so tons of folks with their fanny packs running into you as they try to take a photo of the sky. We accidentally took a right out of the side entrance (West Hastings) and didn't have the best first impression of Vancouver but once we scurried back to the hotel and got a map, we were golden and fell in love with this beautiful city. THE BAR has great natural light during the day with big and comfy leather chairs. We met the kindest bartender there - her name escapes me but she was newly pregnant and a sweetheart - we could not have been more pleased with her hospitality and guidance of the city. Overall, incredible hotel. A little pricey, we would have preferred something a little less but the hospitality, warmth, luxury, location and generous upgrades definitely made up for it.

Reviews.Title: “friendly,quiet,comfy hotel..brilliant!”
Reviews.Author: irishtony
Reviews.Content: my wife and i were on our honeymoon and decided to stay in the delta vancouver suites..and we're really glad we did.to begin with it cost us around $70 to get a taxi from the airport with all our luggage and a bike box-lovely.the taxi driver was a cool dude as well.anyway,the hotel is beside the ferry terminal,the subway system and buses stop all around the block on which the hotel is situated-totally excellant for those of you who want to travel around this amazing city with the locals.you can walk out the door of the hotel for 5 minutes,jump on a 20 minute ferry to see grouse mountain and the capilano suspension bridge.you can walk around the corner and into gastown(the tourist stuff) or you can have a lovely 15 minute walk into downtown to shop.this is a class hotel and the staff can't help you enough-if you are still in any doubt,there are loads of decent pubs near the hotel-namely,the steam packet(ace food and quality pale ales)and the cambie..this is an ace pub,totally down to earth and cheap with great ales!!!can you ask for any more than this? trust me on this,the delta vancouver suites is a lovely hotel,its raesonably cheap,its nice and quiet and its near everything you could possibly want from a city hotel.GET IT BOOKED!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: mmctrip
Reviews.Content: I would agree with the previous reviews of this hotel. It is very, very clean and has excellent security. The rooms are very large and the beds are very comfortable. It is a full service hotel in a central location. The staff were courteous. The restaurant is excellent. The issue I had was that I requested a non-smoking room. Unfortunately, I was placed next to a smoking room without being told in advance. As a result I suffered with ongoing asthma coughing episodes as the poor ventilation provided a steady supply of second hand smoke from the chain smoker next door (He smoked from 6:00 a.m to 1:00 a.m). I did mention the problem when I checked out and was told I should have mentioned this when booking? I thought requesting a non-smoking room was enough. I was told this hotel has rooms on each floor that are designated as smoking. Had I known this I would not have booked at this chain. If you are not bothered by second hand smoke then this hotel is overall a nice property to stay at. My suggestion to this hotel and others would be to adopt a non-smoking policy. If they choose to have smoking rooms then guests with adjoining rooms should be warned at check-in and given the option of another location. Second hand smoke is a health problem for the hotel staff and guests.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value from Hotwire $110/nite”
Reviews.Author: JWLOrangeCounty
Reviews.Content: I was there for a trade show for 5 nights. Service was excellent. Room especially was crip clean and amazingly comfortable, like sleeping in clouds. Nice setup in the workarea with a L shape work desk. In room internet connection was $10 a day, but connection and unstable to my laptop. That would be the ONLY complaint I had. I ordered room service once and my food arrived quickly within 30 minutes and warm. I definitely stay there again but just not sure if I can get it agian through Hotwire.

Reviews.Title: “Second best Hotel I've ever stayed in!!!!”
Reviews.Author: MarketCrashesIn2011
Reviews.Content: Luck of the draw on this hotel. I booked it through Hotwire, which I've had some pretty good luck with. Only one bad experience through Hotwire. I booked this one for the downtown Vancouver location. The hotel seems brand new and the hotel staff was very courteous. At $104.00 US per night, I did not knowing what I was getting into. I could not have been more pleased. This hotel had ceiling to floor windows from a corner suite. The living area had a separate TV and was could be closed off from the bedroom. I could not have asked for a better hotel in a better city. The bed was VERY comfortable and had at least six pillows with down feathers. I slept like a baby! The mattress is similar to the the Westin's Heavenly mattress. Excellent hotel!!! Great price!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and an amazing restaurant”
Reviews.Author: Beanie72
Reviews.Content: Just spent this past weekend at the Delta Vancouver Suites (DVS) after a week long business trip in North Vancouver with my parents who live on Vancouver Island. I use to work for Fairmont Hotels (who owns Delta Hotels) and have stayed in some nice properties and this is by far one of the top. An amazing view from all sides, excellent washroom, good location near the Waterfront Station, and friendly staff who always said "hello" or "good morning" when they passed you. But the top marks would be for the Manhattan Restaurant. My parents and I ate there one dinner and two breakfast together with my parents, while my parents had another dinner there as well. The service was excellent, the food was incredible and for a city hotel, the price was reasonable. The first dinner we had for two soups, three sandwichs and beer for me came to $58 with tax. The breakfast were excellent with big portions and instead of home fries they gave you a big fruit salad. The only negative thing would be the sofa bed I slept on wasn't too comfy (but when is a sofa bed comfy) and the living room area had no real heat control and could get cold. In closing, I highly recommend this hotel and I look forward to staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, gorgeous hotel”
Reviews.Author: piink
Reviews.Content: Spent 3 nights here at the beginning of our holiday and it is gorgeous, everything is so big and spacious. We had a suite with two double beds (although I would not class them as quite double in relation to UK sizes) but with one each you cant complain. The rooms are huge and well decorated with floor to ceiling windows, although the views are just buildings during the day wait til the evening and it looks so much different. This hotel is very close to Gastown and other attractions. It could not be closer to the Harbour centre which I would definately recommend booking a table in the revolving restaurant at the top - the views are amazing. The reception staff are very helpful with any queries. Tip- ask for an upgrade and you never know you may get one. Esp if you are on honeymoon or celebrating something then email the hotel first and they will try and upgrade you if they are able.

Reviews.Title: “Sweet Suites!”
Reviews.Author: racoon2007
Reviews.Content: This is a fantastic hotel with the best beds I have ever slept in! From the start the staff were exceptional, providing a top class service. The location is excellent for exploring Vancouver city and the view from the suite is an added bonus. On arrival we decided to pay a little extra for an upgrade and it was well worth it. The rooms are slightly more spacious the higher the floor. A few tips-a great Starbucks opposite for a wonderful latte and lots of fast food places and cafes nearby for a quick bite to eat. One note of caution-on the first night the doorman warned us not to walk a couple of blocks west of West Hastings street and we were grateful of the tip. When we explored the next day there were some threatening characters. Nevertheless I would recommend this hotel and I would definitely stay in this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “Sweet hotel!”
Reviews.Author: drag-po
Reviews.Content: I spent last week at a conference in Vancouver and rather than staying at the conference hotel, I stayed at the Delta Suites. I am really impressed with this hotel. Not only is this a great property – though I might be a little biased by the extraordinary 16th floor corner suite I got – it is a hotel that does all of the little things that make a difference. I've never seen a Delta have a turndown service, leave chocolates and a bottle of water on your pillow every night, and go the extra step everytime you pass an employee. Plus, it's cheap. I will stay again next time I'm in Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “it's all good!”
Reviews.Author: hipgal!
Reviews.Content: I travel between vancouver and toronto often - this is a quality hotel, great location, well kept with truly professional staff and I'd recommend it to anybody - i stay here fairly regularly and have never been disappointed/ 2 thumbs up

Reviews.Title: “Great for a Conference”
Reviews.Author: LadnerDad
Reviews.Content: Just finished staying at this hotel for two nights. My union was giving two days of training at the attached Morris J Wosk Centre for Dialogue (basically a conference centre). The rooms were great, the staff was friendly and effiicient, and the food was good. I attempted to check in before 3pm, and was given a room right away (and a fresh chocolate-chip cookie to boot). The bar on the main floor had a decent selection of drinks. The drink special on Friday night was a pint of a micro-brew lager for under $5, which is a really good price for a hotel bar. The Manhattan Restaurant served a decent, if somewhat small, steak as a selection for the dinner that had been arranged for us (the other selection was salmon). The snacks that the hotel/conference centre provided for our coffee breaks were also quite good, and there was something different for each break. The hotel is in a pretty good location downtown, only a couple of blocks from Waterfront Station, the mall and GM Place.

Reviews.Title: “Nice for the price...”
Reviews.Author: pachelad
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed this hotel. We booked through hotwire for a quick weekend getaway in Vancouver. The room was very clean. The hotel was well located near the Harbor Center. If you are in Vancouver for a cruise, this would be a great location to stay for a reasonable price. We did not attend in conjunction with a cruise, but we walked to the cruise dock on a beautiful sunny day. Our front desk staff, Nadia and Megan, were able to book reservations at restaurants. We had great meals at several local restaurants. Lucy Mae Brown was one notable restaurant- a fantastic meal with amazing service. Delta Vancouver is a great space. Suite-style rooms with a separate space for TV and work. Comfortable duvet covered beds are the big plus. Cookies at check-in. Cabs are readily available. Use this hotel. As an US citizen, I normally choose Starwood or Marriott for loyalty programs or discounts. This Canadian hotel chain exceeded my expectations with this property.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous for the price!”
Reviews.Author: Sujico
Reviews.Content: The front desk clerk was professional, very polite and friendly. She gave us a room on the upper floor. View from the big windows were fabulous. We, three female adults, had a room with two double beds and a sofa bed (single bed size). When I made a reservation, I was told that I could ask a rollaway if a sofa bed was not comfortable for me. I'm short and small, so the sofa bed was fine. There is a business center behind the front desk and we could use the free internet there. This hotel is definetely gorgeous for the price.

Reviews.Title: “++Pet Friendly++Great location, spacious rooms, good service, reasonable prices”
Reviews.Author: sadiepoo
Reviews.Content: My husband & I have stayed at the Delta Vancouver Suites about 8 times now. We didn't have a very good experience last time - the alarm went off at 4 am and hotel employees had no idea what to do - so I complained and management gave me a free 2-night stay. We decided to use it on 12/15-12/17 and it couldn't have been better timing since we are from the Seattle area and had no power for 3 days. The biggest plus to this place is that they allowed us to bring our boxer. The staff was super friendly to our dog and complimented on her every time we walked through the lobby. They also gave us a bag of treats. The room is pretty nice w/ a sitting area, desk, large windows and large bathroom. There is a park about a block and a half away and we also found a dog beach where she had a blast. Vancouver BC is much more pet friendlier than Seattle is. I think she had more fun than we did! One scary thing is that I got a call from my credit card company saying that the hotel tried to charge my credit card $86,000! When I talked to the front desk about it they acted like it was no big deal and that it happens all the time (when the person checking you in forgets to put a limit on the deposit). I let it slide because it didn't go through and the good things about the hotel superseded the bad. We had room service for breaksfast, which was wonderful, and had a snack in the bar at the lobby. The prices are reasonable and not too spendy (compared to Seattle). I would definitely stay here again because it's only blocks within Robson and a block away from the shopping mall so you don't really need a car. I was disappointed that we couldn't go to the aquarium because Stanley Park was closed from the storm.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: jenncruz
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Delta Vancouver Suites for 5 days on vacation and we loved it. All the staff we encountered on our stay were very friendly and welcoming. I can't say enough about how impressed I was with the quality of service at this hotel- it was top-notch and I am hard to please. We did a lot of sight-seeing and the concierge was consistenly helpful and knowledgable. The spa was the only thing "off" about the hotel as it's not actually a spa. You book your appointment with the hotel and they contract the service out. Also, it's in another building that you can only get access to through the third floor. That was a little strange, but I did get an amazing massage that I can't complain about.

Reviews.Title: “Great for business travellers”
Reviews.Author: magoosie
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 4 nights in September while on business in Vancouver. Loved the fact that it was a suite - you don't open your door to room service to have them see your bedroom! Also, loved the office setup as I needed to do a fair amount of work each evening. Near to shopping, restaurants, beautiful views. Would improve room service breakfast. It arrives VERY quickly but was always cold. Staff was great - fruit plate in room on arrival was wonderful after a long trip.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic”
Reviews.Author: stevenageborofcfan
Reviews.Content: it was all brilliant even the portors were great.!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! we were in the best suit and it was fantastic!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! but don't turn right out into gas town!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “fantastic hotel!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: radders31
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel, the staff were the friendliest we have ever met in North America and the accommodation was fantastic, location very handy for everywhere. The rooms were brilliant, we are a family of five and we had plenty of room in the suites. I work for a travel agent in the UK and would recommend this hotel to anyone, thank you very much Delta we will be staying with you again.

Reviews.Title: “What a great hotel !”
Reviews.Author: Islandfamily
Reviews.Content: My husband, two young daughters and I recently stayed at this fine establishment while attending a family wedding in the area. From the start of our stay until we departed I have cannot say enough about the calibre of this hotel. The service was as good if not better than we have had in 5 + star resorts ! The front desk staff, guest services etc were second to none. Two very telling indications: While on the elevator, I had the pleasure of having one of the guest services staff join me on another floor. When I said good morning, she quickly said....room 1106 ? To which I replied yes how did you know. She indicated that she had taken my call that am and then called me by name ! The second telling event was when my family arrived back tired from the family wedding only to have one of the valet staff say....how was the wedding, you folks look great. It is this personalized attention to detail that in my mind differentiates a good hotel from an excellent hotel. The room was wonderful for us....we had a queen bed in a separate room and a pull out couch for the kids in a sitting area. We did see a room with two doubles but the sitting area is limited so I would definately suggest the room we had for family travellers. I would recommend this hotel highly. On another note stay away from the Brew-works restaurant in Whister. Bad food, long wait and it really demonstrated poor quality and service to us. The manager there needs a serious lesson in leadership and taking responsibility......when we complained after my young daughter was in tears waiting 45 mins for her food, the manager blamed just about every one of her staff .....really turned us off !! It did serve to reinforce our excellent experience at the Delta however !

Reviews.Title: “Bad Service throughout”
Reviews.Author: daveCWashingon
Reviews.Content: We signed up for the romance package which should have included: one-night's accommodation in a Delta-category suite continental breakfast for two Aromatherapy gift basket a bottle of sparkling wine valet parking turndown service as advertised on their web site. [------]Upon arriving I was greeted by the Valet, who proceeded to inform me (before even introducing himself) that it would be $21.50 for valet service however I could park the vehicle myself for only $20.00. I understood this to imply the hotel would validate their parking. The valet then turned and walked away without waiting to see what service I would prefer. However, he did park the car in front and behind my car without explaining to those drivers the cost of valet. I did park my own car after the attendant implied I could not afford valet service. The front desk clerk who checked me in only informed me of my room number. I had to inquire how to get to my room, and where parking was located. Since I have never been to this establishment I did not realize that I would need directions from the parking garage to my room (the clerk only gave directions from the front desk). Our room did have the aromatherapy package on our bed. The sparkling wine was not in the room. I called the front desk at 3:30 p.m. and was informed that someone would start delivering to the rooms at 3:00. I think it should have been brought to the room with the aromatherapy basket. We went to the spa for a couple hours, which was fine, good pool, hot tub, sauna and showers. When we came back to our room the wine had not yet been delivered; however, we did have a little plate of fruit. We never did receive the sparking wine. We left early the next morning. I hope this was merely a bad day for the entire staff of Delta Suites and not the standard.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We were in town to see a concert at Deer Lake Park in Burnaby and decided to use Vancouver's public transit system to get around. This hotel is located just a block from the Waterfront "Skytrain" station, so getting to the hotel from the airport by bus and to the concert venue by train was super easy. We arrived early (1.5 hrs prior to the 3pm check in time) and were accomodated right away, we even received a warm chocolate chip cookie! We were very impressed with the decor of the lobby and our suite. After arriving back to the hotel late on a Sunday evening, we ordered from the hotel's late night menu. It was nice to see they offered more than just a cold sandwich. We got our meal in about 10 minutes and really enjoyed the quality of our late night meal (besides the fact we were famished and could of eaten anything about that time) and the price I found reasonable. We had a great sleep in the hotel's comfy bed, and were not bothered by any Monday morning traffic noise. Maybe being on the 9th floor had a little to do with that. There was a coffee machine in the room but we opted to hit the Starbucks across the street. (There's also a Tim Horton's across the street) Overall, we enjoyed our 1 night stay at this hotel. The staff was pleasant, the room was comfortable and fashionable, and the location was within walking distance to Gastown, Canada Place, Robson Street, and Stanley Park. I would definately recommend this hotel to anyone! I recommend catching an IMAX film over at Canada Place as well as renting bicycles on Denman Street to tour Stanley Park, they rent the bikes by the hour and you can circle the park leisurely in about 1 to 1.5 hours.

HotelInfo.Name: Delta Vancouver Suites
HotelInfo.Address: 550 West Hastings Street, Vancouver, British Columbia V6B 1L6, Canada
